story:
Short Summary

Hi, my name is Marcus Anthony Nesby, Age 14, entrepreneur and aspiring CEO of StikMAN Apparel.

In my short life, I have enjoyed the thrills and wonders of active outdoors sports such as skateboarding, snowboarding, motocross, and most recently Lacrosse.  

In 2011, when I was only 11 years old, I came up with the idea that I wanted to design extreme sport apparel.  Since then, I have created several logo(s) and mass produced articles of apparel including caps, beanies and t-shirts for fun and to hand out to teammates and friends.  Recently, I created a logo for Lacrosse.  I chose Lacrosse because I have been playing the sport of Lacrosse for the last 4 years.  Lacrosse is a sport that is rapidly gaining momentum on the West Coast and I would like to take advantage of the movement and my creativity. 

What is Behind the StikMAN Name/Logo?

The sport of Lacrosse involves using a stick.  And… as many of you parents out there know this…  The body build of many young teens, as they make their way into manhood, is stick-like in form.  So Yes, you guessed it.  I am a thin build young teen making my way into manhood and M.A.N. are my initial.


What We Need & What You Get

 I will need about $8,000 in order to break StikMAN onto the market. That will includes marketing, materials, labor and related expenses for designs and production. 

Start-up Cost Breakdown
Design Software $700.00
Faster Laptop $1,200.00
Add'l Trademarks  $2,500.00
Website Design & Hosting $1,000.00
Marketing Material $1,600.00
Trade shows $1,000.00
Total Start-up Cost $8,000.00

As a thank you for your support, each donation will receive StikMAN stickers and donations of $25 or will receive a beanie or cap (snap back or fitted) with your choice of colors.  

If I do not reach my goal, my priorities for the funds are:  Design Software, Trademarks, and Trade Shows.


The Impact

The cool thing about StikMAN is that it is created BY a teen FOR other teens.  StikMAN is giving voice to teen's values, expressing their dreams, and reflecting back to the world who this new generation believes themselves to be.  I am part of a whole new generation of young people seeking to create their own destiny instead of being led by the herd.

While most kids stick with lemonade stands, I am a young entrepreneur that wants to take my business much further.  – This fact prompted me to dig deeper into a solution for the lacrosse apparel world.  This is where I started to envision StikMAN Apparel and all the possible benefits:

Caps, Beanies with our logo, Hats, T-shirts, Tank Tops, Socks, and Stickers.  The brand name can be expanded into other stick sports.  


Risks & Challenges

Although StikMAN®  apparel is unique in its approach to representing lacrosse and other stick sports through its ball caps and beanies, it faces several challenges.  The main hurdles to overcome are obtaining financing, competing against established apparel lines and developing strong sales channels to promote the StikMAN line. 

To overcome the challenges, StikMAN  brings to the market the opportunity for the young players of stick sports to be the main stars by focusing on them and their supporters rather than promoting establish pro players. This will also assist in bringing more awareness and interest in lacrosse. 


Other Ways You Can Help

StikMAN needs pledging, but above all it needs your attention and interest! If you love this product as much as we do, then please take a moment share this campaign.  

Help us spread the word and get things started!

story:
Slippsy is a brand of colorful unisex design slippers. Our mission is to bring happy colorful mood into every household and make people feel cheerful and relaxed. We want to make your day just a little bit happier. Support us and we will give you the most enjoyable pair of slippers you have ever owned.

  • 100% local manufacturing, designed in Prague, made in European union
  • Handmade production with personal touch
  • Inspecting every piece for individual quality 
  • Colourful playful designs, using high quality cotton fabrics 
  • Comfortable padding

  • To lease industrial space and obtain remaining sewing equipment to make our in house production more effective
  • To cover the production of our current 8 designs
  • To Increase our product portfolio of new designs

Do you still hesitate which option suits you best? Here we made graphic visualisation for your better picture.



Q: When do we choose our design and size?

A: You'll get an email with instructions on how to pick the colour and size of your slippers.

Q: How much will shipping cost?

A: We're pleased to offer FREE SHIPPING WORLDWIDE.

Q: When will our slippers be shipped?

A: We aim to ship all the slippers in September 2016.

In case you have any other question, please don´t hesitate to contact us. :)

story:
When you give, you have the opportunity to make a tremendous difference in the lives of cancer patients by supporting innovative cancer patient care, research, education and prevention programs.

Together we can dramatically accelerate the pace of converting scientific discoveries into clinical advances that reduce the devastating effects of cancer. Fundraising is a large part of our mission because it creates hope. Decide on the amount to raise.  Your goal could be $1 or $1,000 or somewhere in between.   

Your Gift Today Will Fund the Future

Many of the cancer treatments that are saving lives today could not be possible without generous donors like you. You have the power to decide how you can shape the future of cancer research and the lives of patients across the nation.   

As for me (a cancer survivor), I am starting a Portable Locker Company designed to provide secured locker storage for participants typically supportive of these Give Back Events.  There will be 500+ storage lockers plus 120 cell phone charging lockers inside the Hot Pink, big-box truck for their use.  The pricing will range from $5 to $20 (S, M, L, XL). With event sponsor participation, these lockers can be FREE to the participants! 

Our ask:  Your one-time donation will allow The Locker House to donate weekly.  The goal is to reach $24,000 and will be spent as follows:  503 storage lockers (S-M-L-XL) plus 120 cell phone charging lockers, 650 combination locks, a generator, lighting for the interior of the truck box, the services of a welder and painter, the paint and the metal, plus advertising materials. Any amount you can provide will sincerely be appreciated. 

The Locker House plans to participate in at least one (preferably 2) events each weekend for the entire year.  (Note there are 20-30 events each weekend within a 4 hr drive of Houston).  Each event will be attended by 5-25000 participants, plus guests, event staff and promoters.  We have all the participant demographics/stats available for your consideration and review.

Risks & Challenges

  1. By being aggressive in our pre-launch, a big challenge now is the number of events that are encouraged by our service and our ability to deliver in a timely manner.  We are working with suppliers to 'fast start' our locker order when we receive the Indigogo funding.
  2. Challenges will also be in asking current event sponsors to pony-up a few more bucks thereby allow the runners for the event-cause(s) to run for free versus paying themselves.   We will be asking the event sponsors to assist us with contacting the sponsors and encourage them to assist. 
  3. With 20-30 running events per weekend, every weekend of the month (in Texas alone) the challenge will be to remain focused and stay on point, not over extending our assets.

 Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Please help to get the word out and make some noise about the campaign.
  • Call your family and friends and friends of friends to help us fund this campaign - every amount provided can help!!
  • Send event promoters, charity groups, fundraisers and foundations our website and Indiegogo site.
  • Volunteer !!!

story:
LIFT is committed to the music experience–from killer headphones to stylish accessories for live events, LIFT exists to help you live in the music!

LIFT is a consumer electronics company that develops some of the world’s most innovative music lifestyle products.  We are excited to introduce our new LIT product lines, which are designed to create an unparalleled experience no matter your environment…from world’s biggest concerts and festivals to the hottest clubs and events, that’s where you’ll find people GETTING LIT!

What are LITGlasses...

After almost 2 years of R&D we successfully engineered the world’s first and only el wire product that is wireless and fully rechargeable using lithium-ion rechargeable battery technology!

This “PATENT PENDING” technology was just the beginning of our mission to create the most innovative and fashionable products available, which ultimately seek to enhance the experience of every individual who wears them, as well as bring people and communities together to share in incredible moments!

Wireless/Micro-USB Rechargeable EL-Wire Glasses

Features:

· Premium quality electroluminescent wire offers maximum brightness and efficiency 

· Rechargeable Li-ion batteries provide for unlimited use (eliminates need to replace battery supply)

· Micro-USB charging port fully recharges device in less than 2 hrs (cable included)

· 5 hours of usage time on constant light and over 10 hours on flash settings per charge

· 3 different modes enable to switch from constant illumination to quick and slow flash functionality

Package Includes:

· Micro-USB charging cable (same as Android phones, etc.)

· Waterproof carrying case (product itself is NOT waterproof)

· 30-day limited warranty (fulfilled by LIFT)

· Current Design- only one model available but can personalize to your style with choice of frames in either black or white and 4 color options (blue, green, pink, red-orange)

·New Designs- Two different models, with both styles available in black or white frames and 6 color options (blue, green, pink, red-orange, white, & yellow)

EL-Wire Shades with AA battery-pack


Features:

· Premium quality electroluminescent wire offers maximum brightness and efficiency 

· Powered by AA batteries providing reliable unlimited use 

· Ultra flexible 4’ ft lead cable gives you plenty of length to pocket allowing to clip to your waist (similar to wearing head phones)

· 10 hours of usage time on constant light and over 15 hours on flash settings per new pair of standard alkaline batteries

· 3 different modes enable to switch from constant illumination to quick and slow flash functionality

· UV-protective lenses can be worn during day like any regular pair of sunglasses

Package Includes:

· 2 AA batteries w/ el wire inverter

· 30-day limited warranty (fulfilled by LIFT)

Wired Series

Original Design- available in 2 different models in 6 el wire color options (blue, green, pink, red-orange, white, & yellow)

Who is LIFT...

LIFT – is a consumer electronics developer that converges style with technology.  Our primary focus is in the music/audio industry where our mission is to produce the most ground-breaking & fashion-forward products on the market.  The LIFT team has been integral members to projects that introduced world’s first fashion/colored headphones; as well as iPhone cases featuring patented functionality, high-end video game peripherals, state-of-the-art 3D glasses, and numerous other consumer electronic products focused around fashion & function.  Some of our past and current retailers include: Amazon, Costco, Best Buy, Guitar Center; as well as numerous international retailers in over 35 countries.

How LIT was born...

It started with an idea that both fans and artists at music and other live events deserve not only better products but also an incredible experience!

Our mission from the very beginning was not only to create a unique and stylish product, but also devices that are interactive allowing fans to be engaged with the production at shows as well as with one another.

Concept Phase

We started from scratch to engineer and develop this one-of-a-kind solution and technology that had previously never existed.

R&D Phase

Knowing the R&D phase was going to take a significant amount of time and investment we also started out by simultaneously selling our hand-made model strictly at events.  This provided us the opportunity to get in front of and interact with fans firsthand so we could gather critical feedback and input that was essential in our efforts to develop the most gratifying product possible.

Beta Phase


Thorough testing was performed to ensure LIFT’s strict quality and standards levels were met before finalizing our current product, and after two challenging years of research and development we were elated with the completion of our 1st generation design and technology!.

Testing Phase

Launch!

Launched in Summer ’13 by partnering with industry leaders by licensing our exclusive technology and products to key brands, events, & artists with custom designs and limited edition versions


And now it’s your turn to…GETLIT!


Future Looks Bright with LIT...

Now that we’ve successfully finalized our core technology and 1st generation design we are continuing on our mission to ensure we offer the most advanced products and innovative technology on the market.  Following our previous development processes and experience, LIFT has utilized our team’s expertise to create groundbreaking new models and solutions.

NEW DESIGNS

Our new designs advance our current models design by making the entire frames structure and housing for the electronic components sleeker and, which is made possible by the minimization/shrinking of the electronic components and upgrading the PCB & battery to provide the most efficient and optimal performing components available

NEW TECHNOLOGY

new technologies will allow us greater design potential, more advanced features, and one of our favorite features which is the ability to create a coordinated live environment and immersive performances to take each new experience to the next level

Currently working with some of the biggest events and artists to finalize our tech solutions that will be integrated into the production of their shows 

Why GETLIT...

Your support will provide us the opportunity to get these incredible new designs to you and the rest of the LIT Community…in a far more expedited manner and with the highest quality standards possible/ensuring we can provide every one of our customers/fans with the premium quality and design, as well as advanced technology available on the market

While it isn’t’ imperative for this campaign funding for our business to survive, as we have been operating for over 2 years developing our products and the technology that is now available, it is critical to our ability to expand and reach our vision of making incredible/groundbreaking products we think you deserve!

story:
***UPDATE***

PRODUCTION FOR THE T-SHIRTS IS JUST ABOUT TO BEGIN!

Stay tuned as by post street is about to launch into full fledge produciton.  We'll keep you updated as the launch date approaches!

WHAT WE ARE

Design. Discover. Deejay. 

by post street is a limited edition t-shirt & deejay company created by Anna & Kat Thorsen.  

by post street is a creative and collaborative source for fashion, house, hip hop and art.

Collections will be released monthly and feature two fashion figures and one DJ.  Each collection will be produced in limited runs, available for 30 days (or until sold out) and paired with an exclusive podcast by the "DJ of the month" (available to download for free).     

Our FIRST podcast is now up on our Soundcloud.  Listen & Download DJ Riccardo Bhi [Milan, Italy] by post street . 

RICCARDO BHI by post street

WHAT WE ARE SET TO DO

Create our first limited edition t-shirt run featuring two fashion figures and the "DJ of the month."  The unisex t-shirts, designed by Anna and featuring exclusive art by Kat Thorsen, are made from 100% organic bamboo cotton.

Provide exclusive access to first official podcast created by the "DJ of the month" Riccardo Bhi from Milan, Italy.

Create a cutting edge website to house sales, podcasts and to provide a continuous creative source of fashion, art and music. 

Plan, promote and execute the launch event that utilizes interactive art and a DJ performance to launch "Collection 1."

 

THE IMPACT

No one can whistle a symphony.  It takes a whole orchestra to play it. - H.E. Luccock

by post street will be:

• The new collaborative wave that combines art, music, fashion and social media.

• The buzz of anticipating and collecting the monthly limited edition t-shirts.

• The discovery and celebration of leading DJ talent from around the globe.

• The power of interactive art events.

• The positive impact on our non-profit partner, Friends For Life.  (by post street will be donating 3% of profits from t-shirt sales to Friends For Life)

• the satisfaction of purchasing a product that is completey produced and manufactured locally.

THE FUTURE

It doesn't stop at "Collection 1":

by post street  anticipates extending services to organizations to provide theme-specific limited edition t-shirt runs for promotional campaigns and fundraisers.

  • Anna Thorsen:   former visual merchandiser and entertainment promoter, Anna is now the editor-in-chief of the multi-city lifestyle website, The Social Life.  She brings over 10 years of experience within the fashion/entertainment industries into her new role as Creative Director for by post street. the-sociallife.com
  • Kat Thorsen, artist, art therapist and author is renowned for her art blog, portraits, therapeutic art classes, craftivism, street art and popular interactive art events. Kat is the resident artist for by post street.katthorsen.wordpress.com

 

JOIN THE COLLABORATION

Help us spread the word by following by post street on Twitter, Instagram and Soundcloud!  

Twitter: @bypoststreet

Soundcloud: @bypoststreet

Instagram: @bypoststreet

  

Video by Julian Bowers 

Song 'Mosambique Travel Plan' by Ost & Kjex

WHAT WE ARE
Design. Discover. Deejay. 
by post street is a limited edition t-shirt & deejay company created by Anna & Kat Thorsen.  
by post street is a creative and collaborative source for fashion, house, hip hop and art.
Collections will be released monthly and feature two fashion figures and one DJ.  Each collection will be produced in limited runs, available for 30 days (or until sold out) and paired with an exclusive podcast by the "DJ of the month" (available to download for free).     
Our FIRST podcast is now up on our Soundcloud.  Listen & Download DJ Riccardo Bhi [Milan, Italy] by post street . 
RICCARDO BHI by post street
WHAT WE ARE SET TO DO
Create our first limited edition t-shirt run featuring two fashion figures and the "DJ of the month."  The unisex t-shirts, designed by Anna and featuring exclusive art by Kat Thorsen, are made from 100% organic bamboo cotton.
Provide exclusive access to first official podcast created by the "DJ of the month" Riccardo Bhi from Milan, Italy.
Create a cutting edge website to house sales, podcasts and to provide a continuous creative source of fashion, art and music. 
Plan, promote and execute the launch event that utilizes interactive art and a DJ performance to launch "Collection 1."
 
THE IMPACT
No one can whistle a symphony.  It takes a whole orchestra to play it. - H.E. Luccock
by post street will be:
• The new collaborative wave that combines art, music, fashion and social media.
• The buzz of anticipating and collecting the monthly limited edition t-shirts.
• The discovery and celebration of leading DJ talent from around the globe.
• The power of interactive art events.
• The positive impact on our non-profit partner, Friends For Life.  (by post street will be donating 3% of profits from t-shirt sales to Friends For Life)
• the satisfaction of purchasing a product that is completey produced and manufactured locally.
THE FUTURE
It doesn't stop at "Collection 1":
by post street  anticipates extending services to organizations to provide theme-specific limited edition t-shirt runs for promotional campaigns and fundraisers.


Anna Thorsen:   former visual merchandiser and entertainment promoter, Anna is now the editor-in-chief of the multi-city lifestyle website, The Social Life.  She brings over 10 years of experience within the fashion/entertainment industries into her new role as Creative Director for by post street. the-sociallife.com




Kat Thorsen, artist, art therapist and author is renowned for her art blog, portraits, therapeutic art classes, craftivism, street art and popular interactive art events. Kat is the resident artist for by post street.katthorsen.wordpress.com



 
JOIN THE COLLABORATION
Help us spread the word by following by post street on Twitter, Instagram and Soundcloud!  
Twitter: @bypoststreet
Soundcloud: @bypoststreet
Instagram: @bypoststreet
  
Video by Julian Bowers 
Song 'Mosambique Travel Plan' by Ost & Kjex

story:
Who / Why?

Thanks for taking the time to check out my campaign! My name is Paul and I design and sell awesome clothes. I need your help to grow and expand my business. Vibrant Eye Clothing is run and managed completely by me. Because of this I'm able to offer some of the highest quality products at lower prices than my competitors.

My biggest issue so far has been limited inventory and my lack of capital. Also, because it takes 3-4 weeks to get new inventory after I place an order it can be a slow process to keep the most popular designs and sizes in stock. 

This is why I need your help!

About the Clothes

I've taken the time to find a manufacturer that makes some of the highest quality clothes. Everything is made out of super soft polyester and it mimics the feel of cotton. Each item is printed using full dye sublimation, and the design covers front and back. Vibrant Eye products are moisture wicking, dry super fast, are wrinkle resistant,  will NOT fade or shrink, and all the space/psychedelic designs look amazing under blacklight. Plus they don't have the white lines or smudges that many other sublimation products have. 

"Top notch tank for sure. I’ve gotten so many high fives and compliments for this shirt it’s awesome. The fabric is extremely comfortable, even after a grueling 8 hour festival, and wicks away sweat beautifully. Would definitely recommend."
"Just received this today and it’s instantly my new favorite shirt! It’s super comfy and the design is phenomenal! I’m really excited to get bombarded with compliments!"
"The quality of material is AMAZING! Shirt is better than expected, and I have already had one stolen from my fiancé! Everyone comments on these awesome shirts!!"



Men's Shirts
Women's Shirts
Men's Tank Tops
Women's Tank Tops
Hoodies
Bikinis 

Men's/Women's Shirts and Tank Tops will be available in all designs.

Hoodies will be available in select designs

Bikinis will be available in 3 space patterns (See below for bikini designs)

>>>To view larger design images, click here!<<<

Men's Tank Tops:

>>>To view more tank top examples, click here!<<<

Men's Shirts:

>>>To view more men's shirt examples, click here!<<<

Women's Tank Tops:

Women's Shirts:

>>>To view more women's shirt examples, click here!<<<

Hoodies:

Bikini Example and Available Designs:

Oh, Did I mention most of the designs look amazing under blacklight?

Astro, Cosmonaut, Spaced, Jungle, Nautilus, Chief, Ocean, and Weed look amazing and glow super bright. The other designs look good also, but to a lesser degree. 


I have had a couple successful crowdfunding campaigns in the past and have hundreds of  happy customers around the world. This isn't something that I've quickly thrown together, it's something that I have lots of experience and knowledge in. I strive to provide the best possible product and the best possible experience to you, the customer. 

Size Charts:

Bikini Top and Bottom Size Chart
Men's Shirt Size Chart
Women's Shirt Size Chart
Men's Tank Top Size Chart
Women's Tank Top Size Chart
Hoodie sizes match up with men's shirt size chart

Risks & Challenges

As with any crowdfunding campaign there are risks and challenges, but with my past experience with crowdfunding and the established relationship with my manufacturer these risks are at a minimum. 

Other Ways You Can Help

I need help getting the word out about this campaign. Sharing to Facebook, Instagram, and other social media sites would be greatly helpful!!


Majority of the pictures are taken by Paul Hooks. Thanks Paul!
http://www.modelmayhem.com/1101349

story:
Saphra.ca is the expression of my craving for bold, chic, affordable shoes and accessories, and the desire to share such deals with others. I'm Joni Thompson, and my sense of style and cost-consciousness has inspired me to start an online store to offer the same to others.

We are located in Calgary, AB, Canada and plan to ship to anywhere in the world!

 

I want to inspire other women to look their best- but not to empty their wallets. Saphra, the Arabic word for yellow, is bold, but never garish; accessible, but never boring. Saphra is for the woman who wants to make a statement.

I've always been interested in fashion, and as my fashion sense evolved, I realized I wanted to help people enhance their wardrobes or get a whole new look at a reasonable price. With Saphra, I've selected affordable and chic pieces. I plan to offer the best of the latest runway fashions making it possible for every woman to be fashionable and frugal. If, like me, you love fashion but hate being broke, Saphra is for you.

Whether you are trying to match celebrities trend for trend or just trying to develop your personal style, cost can be a real barrier.

 

 

The dream of offering affordable, fashionable shoes and accessories is one I'd like to share with you. Being a 21 year old budding entrepreneur, I have talent and energy on my side. However, my ambition and sense of style aren't enough to get a standard small business loan from a bank. Your contributions will lay the ground work that helps make chic shoes and accessories available to all.

Your contribution will transform Saphra from dream to reality in the following ways:

Developing Inventory - I plan to offer the latest fashions, which makes it essential to get the best deals fast.

Storage - Protecting these fashionable items from damage and loss is key to keeping prices low.

Internet Presence - Establishing and maintaining Saphra's online presence will require services to help the budding Saphra community stay in touch with the latest news and sales.

Total needed to get Saphra out of my head and onto the internet runway: $5500. Anything over our goal will go directly into inventory so we can provide even more amazing items.

 

You’re probably asking “How can I help?!”

1. Donate- a little or a lot, and I'll send along a bonus to show how much I appreciate my supporters.

Take a look to your right. Choose the amount you are able to donate and then see what perks you'll get for your contribution.

 

2. Tell me what you'd like Saphra to offer. Is there a certain style in shoes or accessories you'd like to see - community feedback is how Saphra will grow.

 

3. Brag about your donation by telling your friends on facebook and twitter. You can also share our link. (www.indiegogo.com/saphra) It's OK to brag just this once.

 

4. Stay in touch for updates. 

 

As part of the Saphra community, you will stay abreast of Saphra's development, including new items and offers, and perspectives on growing trends. Coming soon will be social media pages so that you can stay in touch, ask questions, and help me shape Saphra's future. With your support, we can give women the confidence that comes with knowing they've made an impression.

story:
Hi there! Hi there! Hi there! Hi There! 

Welcome Waldenites! We’re the Surfers of 2002. With all the spare time we had in 2020, we  decided to put the hours we spent in Arts & Crafts (OH YEAH!) to good use. We’ve lovingly designed and produced a set of 5 enamel pins, featuring some of your Walden favs:

  • Iconic Walden Shorts
  • Orange Tie
  • Schnecken
  • Walden Sign
  • W Pennant 


Whether you want to add them to your orange tie or rock them on a jean jacket, these pins will surely add some much needed pep and spirit to your day! 

A few additional details about the pins: Each soft enamel pin is 1.25” and has a 8mm post Butterfly Clutch backing. The metal color is Polished Black Nickel. 

Something New in 04022

Camp Walden launched the Something New in 04022 campaign in 2020 to invest in the future of our favorite place. Each pin set purchase will directly benefit Camp Walden’s fundraiser and will subsidize the cost of production, shipping, and packaging (approximately $17.30 per set).

Honor System

We have only produced 95 pin sets to start. While the offer is fairly exclusive, we want the price point to be accessible to all. However, the intention is to raise as much money as possible for Something New in 04022. We’ve created a few pricing tiers so everyone has the opportunity to get in on these super fun donation perks. 

  • Current Camper - You’ll be rocking the pins on your orange tie this summer and you’ll donate $42* to Walden.
  • Young Alum - You were Bunk 12 within the last 10 years and are looking for a way to spruce up your WFH look. You’ll be donating about $56* to Walden. [No longer available]
  • Pin Pal - Whether you’re buying a set for you, your campsister, or another alum, you’ll be sending nearly $70* to Walden Drive.
  • Power Tower - You’re pumped about the pins, but even more excited to offer $120* to the Something New in 04022 fundraiser.  [No longer available - but feel free to donate!]


We will not be checking IDs, but hope you’ll choose the tier that makes most sense for you. Remember, it’s a system based on unity and trust! 

*This subtracts cost of set, packaging, delivery fees, and IndieGoGo fees.

story:
Hi We are Stacey and Kenzie from "Illuminated Vintage"!

“Illuminated Vintage” (full team includes Amie Mae) is a fashion project that was exhibited in the sold out 2014 MakeFashion event based out of Calgary, Alberta. We are looking for your help to get us to Maker Faire Rome 2014 this October!

If you are wondering, MakeFashion is an initiative that introduces talented local designers to cutting edge new technologies, and wearable technology experts.

With an background education in fine art, our team set out to approach our MakeFashion wearable tech project from a contemporary, performative, and  interactive angle. We took on the exciting challenge to work with a technology engineer (Dan Damron), to create our wearable tech vision; a vintage inspired very colorful tech savvy fashion collection. For ladies like us who love that classy retro look!

The “Illuminated Vintage” collection features bright classic dress designs, and accessories such as a paracel, a feather fan, fascinators, and hats that all react to, sound, touch, movement, or the wearers pulse. Almost all of the garments are using cutting edge wearable technology developed by Seeed Studios.

Since the 2014 show, many of the outfits themselves have been presented at MakerFaire’s and wearable tech events, in San Francisco, Calgary, and Shenzhen, China. Sadly we the designers have never been able to travel with the “Illuminated Vintage” collection on these showcase adventures. Although to our excitement, through MakeFashion we have been invited to attend the 2014 Rome Maker Faire with our collection. This would be the first time we will actually get to attend a MakerFaire event with our pieces, allowing us to experience the audience’s reaction, and answer questions about our work. This and more will all be possible with your assistance!

On a Personal Level...

Attending this event will definitely be inspiring for both of us. Allowing us to see and learn about new technology while meeting industry experts and interacting with other designers. Also on an exciting note, we have been accepted to exhibit at the 2015 MakeFashion event. What we see and who we meet in Rome will undoubtedly allow us to grow as designers and shape our already amazing project ideas for next year!

The Wearable Tech Revolution...

Funding this Indiegogo will give you the opportunity to help showcase new Canadian makers like us on a world stage. Really allowing us to become a part of the wearable tech revolution. It will also further establish Calgary MakeFashion as a leading wearable tech organization, an amazing group which has inspired and supported people like us; Stacey and Kenzie to grow as tech based artists, and designers.

This will all be possible thanks to you! We are working on some really neat stuff and we want you to be a part of making it happen! 


What We Need...

Flights from Calgary to Rome – $2500 (or best we can get!)

Hotel for 5 days – $400

Maker Faire supplies and subsistence - $100

Total Expenses: $3000.00

We are working on getting partial funding for this trip and running this indiegogo campaign will go far in helping show our potential sponsors how serious we are about wearable tech and getting our ideas and designs out there!

All money will go directly into travel expenses, left over funds will be invested back into MakeFashion and our 2015 team project concept.


What You Get...

Now you're probably wondering what amazing perks you can get for contributing!

For $5 A personal e-mail from us thanking you with all our hearts!

For $15 A tweet out thanking you for with lots of love!

For $35 MakeFashion T- shirt

For $50 LED earrings   For $100 LED earrings and MakeFashion T-shirt


For $150 Invite to attend a private MakeFashion designer tech workshop! Were you can rub elbows with creative people passionate about the wearable tech revolution.


For $200 Kenzie and Stacey will make you a hand-made one of kind light-up fascinator/hairpiece inspired by our Illuminated Vintage collection! (if you are a fellow we will work something  super neat out for you) 


For $250 Kenzie and Stacey will make you a hand-made one of kind light-up fascinator/hairpiece inspired by our Illuminated Vintage collection! (if you are a fellow we will work something  super neat out for you) and you will get 2 tickets to our Tech Burlesque showcase event. You will fit right in with your retro wearable tech hair-piece.


For $500 Drinks with MakeFashion designers, engineers, and wearable tech enthusiasts, and an invite to MakeFashion 2015 after party!


For $1000 Exclusive backstage invite to the MakeFashion 2015 fashion show rehearsal, and an invite to the MakeFashion after party event!    For $1500 Limited VIP tickets to MakeFashion


    Other Ways You Can Help

     If you can't contribute with a dollar amount, just try and get the word out on twitter and facebook about the campaign. Every little bit counts!

story:
Thank you!!!


We are very excited that Safelet is now 100% funded (actually, 102%)!! A very big thank you to everyone who supported and shared our campaign! We are thrilled that so many people share our dream of a safer world. We will now get ready for all regulatory testing, finish the app and determine our production partner. 

To celebrate our success and allow even more people to benefit from our introduction discounts we have extended our campaign till the 9th of August!


The Basic Idea 

What is Safelet?

When you need help, you can use Safelet to send an alarm to your friends, family and the police with your exact location.

Your security is enhanced at multiple levels :

1 – The simple activation of Safelet allows you to send out an alarm even if you have very little time. Something which would not be possible using your mobile.

2 – With one simple click you can notify a wide network of people. We like to call these people your guardians. You can make your network as big as you want. First of all by inviting all your friends and loved ones into your guardian network. But if you want an even bigger network, Safelet can send your alarm to everyone in the Safelet Community in your vicinity.

3 – Safelet provides your exact location to the police which, in many countries, they can not obtain otherwise.

Safelet creates a platform which allows safety to become something we create together. Hence our slogan, Safety is what we do for each other!


Safelet works with the Safelet app on iOS and Android. The Safelet app is used to establish a Bluetooth low energy connection between Safelet and your smartphone.

Once Safelet and your phone are connected, you can use the app to invite your friends and family to become your guardians.

If you want to be protected by an even bigger network, simply select the the option that enables your alarm to be sent to other people in the Safelet Community that are, at the moment of the alarm, close to you.

From now on you are connected and protected by people who will be there when you need help.


The perks 

New perks! 


Why did we develop Safelet?

There is (sexual) violence against women. We knew that. But we were shocked by its epidemic dimensions. It started with a small article in Amsterdam newspaper ‘Het Parool’. It stated that each day 2 women reported an incident of sexual assault. The police expected the numbers to be 4 times higher. We were astonished. Why aren't the individual cases front page news every day? Why the silence? 

Two studies, one conducted by the World Health Organization and one by the European Union, showed statistics that truly opened our eyes. Almost 35% of all women, regardless of where they live, experience sexual assault (source: World Health Organization, Factsheet No.239, October 2013). More than 50% of all women make decisions that restrict their freedom of movement. No stroll through the park, not working late in the office, not taking the shortest route (source: Violence against women, an EU-wide survey, FRA, March 2014)

Sometimes an individual case gets the attention all cases would deserve, often because of its extreme brutality. The case of the Indian girl, known under the pseudonym Damini, has always been on our mind (source: Indians on outrage over rape in moving bus in New Delhi. The New York Time, December 18, 2012).

It’s out of love for our daughters, sisters, friends, co-workers and mothers that we have created Safelet. If we are willing to make Safety something we do for each other, we can create a safer world for women. 

What others say about Safelet 



Safelet design process

A wearable safety device like Safelet, is only useful if it is worn. We wanted to ensure we could design an elegant and stylish device that people would want to wear. This created a challenge for us: how do we fit in all of the technology we need, while keeping the design sleek and elegant. Too many wearable electronic devices look like bulky gadgets , and that was the sort of design we wanted to avoid. We ended up partnering with leading manufacturers of Bluetooth radios and electronic components to miniaturize our design and ultimately produce a beautiful design you will be proud be wear. 

Component lay out 

Our design concept is based on a stack design, centered atop a curved lithium ion rechargeable battery. Above that sits our primary circuit board which carries our radios, microphone, charge controller circuitry, a notification light, and connections to the emergency switches. 


From the ground up 

We started by designing a much larger proof of concept board, which carried radios and test points which allowed us to validate our design before trying to miniaturize it. Right from the start, we partnered with and worked out of engineering facilities with really great prototyping equipment and expertise. We were able to quickly develop a working functional prototype and knew we had something that worked. The challenge now focused on shrinking it down to fit a wrist. 

Speaking of wrists, we found out that there are huge differences in wrist sizes. So we could forget about 'a one size fits all solution'. Especially because we didn't want Safelet to turn upside down whilst wearing. This would make it more difficult to activate the alarm. The solution lay in an adjustable milanese mesh wrist band that will fit 99% of all wrists.

During the entire process, we probably looked into 30 different designs. 29 of those could be discarded because they didn't meet the approval of our panel of 'wise women and girls'. They judged the early designs on one simple criterium: 'would I wear it?".

The final model of Safelet has a slim and compact design. Choosing a metal housing instead of plastic allowed us to keep it very thin (0,35 inches or 9mm) without compromising strength and durability. With the adjustable milanese wrist band, the blind closure of the housing and the silverfish finish, Safelet's style refers right back to an archetypical bracelet.

Safelet app

We wanted to keep the Safelet app as simple and easy to use as possible, while including the most important features. 

The Safelet app is used to: 

  • set up an account 
  • pair Safelet with your smartphone 
  • invite and manage the people in your guardian network 
  • turn 'on' or 'off' the possibility to make a call to the police 
  • turn 'on' or 'off' the possibility of a sound alert on your smartphone once Safelet is activated 
  • deactivate Safelet within 30 seconds in the case of a false alarm.  

The Safelet app is pretty much still work in progress but below you can already some screens. 


Where we're at 

We have worked over a year on the concept, design and development of the first prototype of Safelet. We now have functional electronic prototypes. Our biggest challenge -'Safelet might not work'- has now been overcome.  

We are almost ready for production and are finalizing our contracts with the suppliers.  At the same time, we are preparing for the final regulatory testing and determining what the best shipping method would be.  


Your Indiegogo Contribution 

Your Indiegogo pledge will allow us to get regulatory approval (FCC and CE), allow us to complete the first release of the Safelet app and, most importantly,  get our first production run in place. 

If we exceed our Indiegogo goal, our first step is to make Safelet customizable with different wristbands and covers.

We are serious about making the world a safer place for all us. And we believe that we can achieve that by simply looking out for one another - with a little help from technology.

Timeline 


Special thanks 

We are very grateful for all the help we got from the people around us who supported our initiative. Some special thanks goes out to:

Saskia Noort for being our ambassador 

FLEX/theINNOVATIONLAB  for their excellent industrial design

Tessa, Eva, Tess, Sarah, Sabah, Anne Fleur, Marien, Marianne, Monique,  Willemijn, Julia, Yvette and Annette for your continuous feedback  

Inhouse Filming for the camera, detailed instructions and editing of the video of some of the interviews we had with the girls

Citizen M hotel Amsterdam for giving us the time and place for our panel sessions  

Simon Bunt for editing our video 

Harumi Motta for her translation skills

Nzinga, Jessie, Michelle and Marien for being our topmodels.  



What did the girls think?
story_txt:
Thank you!!!We are very excited that Safelet is now 100% funded (actually, 102%)!! A very big thank you to everyone who supported and shared our campaign! We are thrilled that so many people share our dream of a safer world. We will now get ready for all regulatory testing, finish the app and determine our production partner. To celebrate our success and allow even more people to benefit from our introduction discounts we have extended our campaign till the 9th of August!
The Basic Idea 
What is Safelet?
When you need help, you can use Safelet to send an alarm to your friends, family and the police with your exact location.
Your security is enhanced at multiple levels :
1 – The simple activation of Safelet allows you to send out an alarm even if you have very little time. Something which would not be possible using your mobile.
2 – With one simple click you can notify a wide network of people. We like to call these people your guardians. You can make your network as big as you want. First of all by inviting all your friends and loved ones into your guardian network. But if you want an even bigger network, Safelet can send your alarm to everyone in the Safelet Community in your vicinity.
3 – Safelet provides your exact location to the police which, in many countries, they can not obtain otherwise.
Safelet creates a platform which allows safety to become something we create together. Hence our slogan, Safety is what we do for each other!Safelet works with the Safelet app on iOS and Android. The Safelet app is used to establish a Bluetooth low energy connection between Safelet and your smartphone.
Once Safelet and your phone are connected, you can use the app to invite your friends and family to become your guardians.
If you want to be protected by an even bigger network, simply select the the option that enables your alarm to be sent to other people in the Safelet Community that are, at the moment of the alarm, close to you.

story:
Mission:

The Darion Cortez brand is dedicated to making women feel & look confident, powerful, strong, & most of all beautiful. When a woman steps into a pair of Darion Cortez heels she will feel her absolute best. Weather it's a day at work, a night on the town, or date with her lover in Darion Cortez heels she knows she's in control. With our sleek designs & distinct heels Darion Cortez shoes are for sure to make a woman stand out among the crowd. In Darion Cortez heels a woman will be fierce & a force to be reckoned with, her inner beauty & strength will shine with every step. Marilyn Monroe said it best "Give a girl the right shoes & she can conquer the world.", well in Darion Cortez heels she will not only feel bold enough to conquer the world, she'll conquer the universe.

What Makes Darion Cortez Different:

Darion Cortez is a brand of the social media era, we like to keep in constant contact with our future customers as much as possible answering any & all questions they may have. We also participate in #stylechat, #GentsChat, #FashionUnfold, & #USBloggerChat to get a sense of what our future customers are looking for during the seasons & what patters/colors/fabrics they get excited about & like to wear. We like to make our future customers feel like they are apart of our journey & we like them to give input on what they would like to see from the Darion Cortez brand so that we can please them with our footwear & other future products. Staying in touch with our future customers means a great deal to us because they are who matter & listening to their input & getting their opinions is what will make Darion Cortez a great brand in the long run.  As long as our future customers are sharing their input & their opinions we are willing to listen.


What We Need & What You Get:

The amount of funding needed is $8000 to pay to have prototypes of shoe designs made to present to department stores & to future customers. If the prototypes are approved by department stores it will convince investors the Darion Cortez brand is worth investing in & with a commitment from an investor the full Spring/Summer 15 collection & other future collections can be produced. There are perks to donating as seen on the side so please chose one & you will not be disappointed.

Spring/Summer 15 Collection


Charlotte Peep

Kelly

Kourtney

Niecy

Shemika

Valerie


Shoe Sizes for Spring/Summer 15

6     6.5     7     7.5     8   (more size options will be added as the brand grows)


Bonus Shoes:

These shoes are designs I think are very special although they are not set to be part of the Spring/Summer 15 collection some may appear in future collections to come.

Rose

Hayden

Lady

Ingrid

Heat Wave

Roxy

Aubrey

Ava


The Future:

Over the next 5 years Darion Cortez plans to introduce men's fashion sneakers, fragrances, & handbags into the brand. We also plan to get in contact with other top department/boutique stores in hopes of putting the Darion Cortez brand on their shelves. By the end of 2020 we would like to open our first store in Los Angeles. Over the next 15 years we'd like to open stores across the US & Europe & become a globally known brand.


About Darion:

Born in raised in St.Louis, MO my love for art started at a young age. Growing up I always knew I wanted to do something with art I just didn't know what it would be. I didn't know what I wanted to do as a career until I was 20 years old & found shoe designing. It started just as a project for a friend who knew I could draw & asked me to sketch a pair of shoes to be displayed in a store & from there I never stopped. Over the last 5 years I have been sketching, learning, & researching non stop about the shoe/fashion industry. I haven't felt as passionate about something in my life as I do with designing shoes. I have stacks & stacks of folders filled with shoe designs & it's growing every day. I started to post some of my designs to social media & got some great feedback on them & that's when I knew I wanted to create my own brand. Launching the Darion Cortez brand is my dream, I can't even put into words how much I love what I do. I would hugely & greatly appreciate your help in helping me live out my dream.

Where To Find Darion Cortez:

We can be found on Twitter: @DarionCortez

Instagram: darioncortezshoes


Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't donate other ways you can help is by sharing the campaign on social media as much as you can.

story:
The Social Experiment

Fashion for Passion

Project:Beautiful Home

Short Summary

Fashion-Social prominence especially as signalized by the arrangement or conduct of apparel, living space, or behavior.

Hello Everyone,

This is a challenge and an experiment; a social challenge to test the ability of individuals selflessness, and an experiment to see if we can pull this off! We; yes we, a leader is no one without his people and a challenge is nothing without opposition.

The rules are simple

1.  Can you make a small selfless act of kindness for a complete stranger without any payload for the benefit of another

2. Will you help me do it in a matter of days; forty-five.

3. We need to get 650,000 facebook fans and sponsors! We can do it, together!!!

Let’s do this!

The Goal

The goal here is to help raise money for the purchase of a beautiful home-in forty-five days-with only .50 cents as a basic contribution per individual.

Please, help me buy my first home

someone once told me you can't be helped if you don't ask,

Will you help me do it for the price of a soda can or small bag of chips?

By pledging your support you’re changing my life!

By pledging your support you are creating The Boomerang effect

Good things done by good people always come back to them!

Happy Karma!

And don’t forget to share the link above on Facebook….

Other Ways You Can Help

Lets make it viral.....

Post the link for this campaign on Facebook, Twitter, G+1, and other social media

Help me get the word out,

Other Contributions

Stick to the basics-the goal of this experiment is to see of we can meet it with very little funding and a great turn out of supporters and sponsors; however, if you wish to sponsor more than $.50 you certainly can. Anything you give will be greatfully received, thank you.

Your contribution counts! That is a concept that will not be overlooked, You are the one who will make this possible.  Like a fiber woven into a thousand weaves in a blanket each fiber is as important to the whole as the other! Together we will succeed!

Thank you to all of my sponsors and supporters! All of the funds and attention are cherished above more than you will ever know: thank you for supporting this cause.

Will It Work

Will this work?

.50 cents per contribution is pocket change but working together we can accomplish the goal,

The answer lies in the Marabunta.  The Marabunta, more commonly known as "the army ant", is a species of ant that has its origins in Africa.  It is one of the most successful ant colonies in existence and has the ability to accomplish colossal feats.  Once the army is on the attack it can be very difficult to deter this threat and everything in its path is consumed. 

So what do the Marabunta and the social challenge have in common?  Well, the answer is simple.  The only way that the Marabunta are able to perform such massive raiding attacks is their strength in numbers.  The ants themselves are very small, but when acting in unison they form a tight-knit cohesive unit capable of accomplishing tasks thousands of times their capabilities as compared to the capabilities of only one individual ant acting alone in a raid.  So can we form a tight-knit cohesive unit working together to ensure the reserves of the social challenge are met.  

"Many hands make work light." Using the maxim on the left and applying it financially:  It can be noted that one cent is hardly worth anything, present day, yet we cannot deny the fact that it takes one-hundred cents to value one dollar. Even that is of small value in today's economic market, but even the tallest building started with a foundation and building blocks on top of that foundation, one by one, helped complete the full structure.  The answer in its completeness is yes, the reserves of the social challenge will be met if we can work together.

Again, to all my supporters I thank you! Your help is making this possible!

story:
About this Project

The Transformable Work to Carry-on Tote is the first bag in a line of bags for professional women-on-the-go, entitled MINIM, to be released by CGC of NYC Accessories, LLC. This production order of 50 to 100 bags will be crucial inventory for the company's first trade show.  This small order will help facilitate PR opportunities and fill immediate small wholesale orders at the trade show.

 

 

How The Product Came To Be:

Hi, my name is Cheron Cowan and I am the product designer of the Transformable Tote and the owner/CEO of CGC of NYC Accessories, LLC. 

The product came about from my travels as a working woman living in New York City and consistently having to commute out of state. One day while en route in an airport, I was stopped at the airline desk, yet again, and was asked to combine bags or pay a fee. This planted a seed that was further nurtured by the desire to have a bag that would adapt with my needs as a woman living in a small New York City apartment and lacking the appropriate storage space for myriad bags.

After completing four to five iterations of the bag over an eleven month period, testing each iteration for four or five weeks at a time, and vetting ten to fifteen different local manufacturers, I made this final prototype you see here on Indiegogo. (My sewing skills have been honed 10 times over as a result of making the prototype time and again.)

Initially, the goal was to manufacturer the bags here in the US. However, the last two local manufacturers that made a prototype encouraged me to seek a factory abroad as the price point per bag would be more economical.  I am now seeking a final sample from a factory I have well vetted and a small production order of 50 to 100 bags initially  for the Travel Goods Trade Show at the end of February in Las Vegas.

Features Of The Bag:

Overall Features

Work Tote Benefits

Carry-On Benefits

How To Transform The Bag:

First, it is important to note that the bag can be transformed while holding the cross-body strap and while in transit. So, the bag never has to be sat down in order for transformation. Also, the middle compartment, that has the pen and pencil holder and keychain, and the contents of the computer/tablet pocket do not have to be removed in order to transform the bag.

The steps for transformation are listed below.

The end result will look like this:

How to transform the carry-on tote back to a work tote:

 

How Will the Money Be Used:

  • about %7 off the top goes towards credit card fees and indiegogo= $700
  • $900 will go towards fulfilling the rewards-(excluding  'work to carry-on tote')
  • %5 contingency fee= $500 (Just in case)
  • $250 for a sample
  • $400 for shipping of sample to and from manufacturer (Yes, priority mail, in order to avoid serious delays in customs, though costly, is most advantageous and prompt)
  • $2100 for materials and moulds for first production run
  • $4350 manufacturing costs for 'work to carry-on tote'
  • $800 Shipping costs of first order (not shipped priority mail)

REWARDS

(PLEASE NOTE: Flower and Collapsable bags are already in inventory.  The Transformable Bag and Reversible Tote will be part of the first order after the trade show.  So, those 2 bags will be received in June.)

  • $1= Thank you!
  • $5= Post Card + Thank you!
  • $15= Your name listed in the "how-to" brochure that comes with each bag+Thank you!
  • $30= 2013 Calendar+ Thank you!
  • $75= Foldable Bag+ 2013 Calendar +Thank you!
  • $150= Flower bag (one of first bag designs I ever created-the creativity of it led to exploring transformable bags.  This bag is a limited edition bag and temporarily has been cut from the MINIM line)- go to www.minimnyc.com/flowerbag to see more.

  • $225-Reversible and Separating Tote (in Black Croc-Embossed leather, Black Leather, and Nylon Cordura)- Go to www.minimnyc.com/reversible to see more.  This is one of the bags in the MINIM line for the trade show.

  • $275- Transformable Work to Carry-on Tote in Brown&Taupe or Black&Stone

  • $5000= Well, you get a bag named after you and one each of the bag combo (Brown&Taupe and Black&Stone)

 

Why this trade show and why have a production order ready?

The Travel Goods Trade show is one of the largest travel and luggage shows.  Originally, this bag was to launch at one of the big fashion trade shows, but as it is geared towards light travel (2 or 3 day trips) and everyday use, it made more sense to spotlight and launch the product there.  (it is also one of the more economical trade shows to participate in.)  Evenmore, while most wholesale orders will be placed in advance, having a small supply will help to have the bag located in various places through out the trade show (for PR purposes) and have a small quantity should someone want to purchase a small inventory for their shop or boutique immediately. As the trade show is in february and the holidays are approaching, their is a 3 week period in which the manufacturer has stated they will be closed.  So, it is imperative that both the factory samples and small production order is placed immediately.

Risks and Challenges of Completing This Project:

1) It was difficult enough to convey the project to local manufacturers (even with technical drawings AND a prototype). But, I have given a similar bag to the manufacturers vetted abroad for this project (with technical drawings) and the results were good. In addition, I have hired a sourcing company(not to be used from the funds I am raising) to execute what I might be missing in communication. This sourcing company went through critical analysis by both myself and my lawyer.

2) Manufacturers do not always deliver on time. I have purposely added a cushion of 30 days to what the manufacturer said they would deliver when they deliver. Also, post the holiday season, the factories are closed for 3 weeks respectively. This means production needs to start before the holiday season.

3) I have spent about $9,000 in research and development of this product of my own money. I would not ask someone else to invest what I would not invest myself.

Why Indiegogo?

Innovative products warrant an innovative approach. To launch this bag in the fashion industry, I have had people in the fashion business insist on 7 different bags for promotion of a line. Evenmore, when some of the people in the fashion industry have seen it, they were uncertain as to whether to categorize the product as a fashion accessory or luggage.... My intent is to bridge both:)

THANKS SO MUCH FOR TAKING THE TIME TO REVIEW MY PRODUCT AND PROFILE!
Cheron Cowan, Product Designer
story_txt:
About this Project
The Transformable Work to Carry-on Tote is the first bag in a line of bags for professional women-on-the-go, entitled MINIM, to be released by CGC of NYC Accessories, LLC. This production order of 50 to 100 bags will be crucial inventory for the company's first trade show.  This small order will help facilitate PR opportunities and fill immediate small wholesale orders at the trade show.
 

 

How The Product Came To Be:
Hi, my name is Cheron Cowan and I am the product designer of the Transformable Tote and the owner/CEO of CGC of NYC Accessories, LLC. 
The product came about from my travels as a working woman living in New York City and consistently having to commute out of state. One day while en route in an airport, I was stopped at the airline desk, yet again, and was asked to combine bags or pay a fee. This planted a seed that was further nurtured by the desire to have a bag that would adapt with my needs as a woman living in a small New York City apartment and lacking the appropriate storage space for myriad bags.
After completing four to five iterations of the bag over an eleven month period, testing each iteration for four or five weeks at a time, and vetting ten to fifteen different local manufacturers, I made this final prototype you see here on Indiegogo. (My sewing skills have been honed 10 times over as a result of making the prototype time and again.)
Initially, the goal was to manufacturer the bags here in the US. However, the last two local manufacturers that made a prototype encouraged me to seek a factory abroad as the price point per bag would be more economical.  I am now seeking a final sample from a factory I have well vetted and a small production order of 50 to 100 bags initially  for the Travel Goods Trade Show at the end of February in Las Vegas.
Features Of The Bag:
Overall Features

Work Tote Benefits

Carry-On Benefits

How To Transform The Bag:
First, it is important to note that the bag can be transformed while holding the cross-body strap and while in transit. So, the bag never has to be sat down in order for transformation. Also, the middle compartment, that has the pen and pencil holder and keychain, and the contents of the computer/tablet pocket do not have to be removed in order to transform the bag.
The steps for transformation are listed below.





The end result will look like this:



How to transform the carry-on tote back to a work tote:

$2100 for materials and moulds for first production run

$5000= Well, you get a bag named after you and one each of the bag combo (Brown&Taupe and Black&Stone)

 
Why this trade show and why have a production order ready?
The Travel Goods Trade show is one of the largest travel and luggage shows.  Originally, this bag was to launch at one of the big fashion trade shows, but as it is geared towards light travel (2 or 3 day trips) and everyday use, it made more sense to spotlight and launch the product there.  (it is also one of the more economical trade shows to participate in.)  Evenmore, while most wholesale orders will be placed in advance, having a small supply will help to have the bag located in various places through out the trade show (for PR purposes) and have a small quantity should someone want to purchase a small inventory for their shop or boutique immediately. As the trade show is in february and the holidays are approaching, their is a 3 week period in which the manufacturer has stated they will be closed.  So, it is imperative that both the factory samples and small production order is placed immediately.

Risks and Challenges of Completing This Project:
1) It was difficult enough to convey the project to local manufacturers (even with technical drawings AND a prototype). But, I have given a similar bag to the manufacturers vetted abroad for this project (with technical drawings) and the results were good. In addition, I have hired a sourcing company(not to be used from the funds I am raising) to execute what I might be missing in communication. This sourcing company went through critical analysis by both myself and my lawyer.
2) Manufacturers do not always deliver on time. I have purposely added a cushion of 30 days to what the manufacturer said they would deliver when they deliver. Also, post the holiday season, the factories are closed for 3 weeks respectively. This means production needs to start before the holiday season.
3) I have spent about $9,000 in research and development of this product of my own money. I would not ask someone else to invest what I would not invest myself.

Evenmore, when some of the people in the fashion industry have seen it, they were uncertain as to whether to categorize the product as a fashion accessory or luggage.... My intent is to bridge both:)

 one world

all of the products are vegan friendly!  rubber, faux fur, plastic and sterling silver are used to avoid the traditional definitions of luxury.  every effort is being made to utilize materials with high recycled content.  for many reasons, manufacturing is held as close as feasibly possible to our base in tribeca, new york.  

made in New York :: our new york team includes; jewelry, handbag, garment, plastic and rubber manufacturers. local new york craftspeople normally working with designers and exclusive limited brands.

we are including free worldwide shipping via our indiegogo campaign.

up to 5% of all contributions will be donated to the Human Rights Campaign to support lgbt equality ... isn't it about time! regardless of contribution totals, a donation of $1,000 will be made to The Cooper Union for the Advancement of Science and Art my beloved alma mater.

we need your help!  助けて!  aider!  救命啊!  hilfe!  ช่วยด้วย!  hulp!  aiuto!  cứu với!  hjelp!  ¡ayúdame! hjälp!  pomoc!  hëllef!  apua!  hjælp!  pomocy!  tarrtháil!  རོགས་པ་གནང་དང་།  помогите!  msaada!  cuidiú!  도와주세요!  socorro!  voíthia!  मदद!  tolong!  hjálp!  segítség!  βοηθήσει!  membantu!  pomoći!  socors!  İmdat!  הצילו!  عتقني!

PLEASE contribute ANY amount, even $1 will have a very positive impact. THANK YOU so much for supporting this MADE IN NEW YORK dream project.

 

 trend setters

the first 100 contributors, will receive a personalized gift as a big thank you for being an early adopter.  well-deserved for your good taste.

 

 press

        the boulevardier blog

        mike shouts

        screen daily

        fashion located

        crowdfunding pr

 

 product descriptions

 keystud tm

reinvented key ring, without the ring ... the next generation will laugh at those still carrying a ring of keys ... adds minimal bulk to your pocket ...  sized for up to 3 keys and with included extender up to 5 keys ... patent pending ... sterling silver

 saddlebag tm (iPad messenger bag)

androgynous daily bag w/o judgement ... sized for the 'daily essentials for the anti-conformist' (tm) and/or iPad ... italian rubber :: faux fur :: hand stitched with japanese cord ... 10.4 x 8.5 in :: 26.5 x 21.5 cm [interior]

 matchbox tm

kraft paper match box ... sized for business cards, cigarettes, or ... note: our products come packaged in similar styled boxes of various sizes ... sold in set of 2 sizes 'russian doll' nested

 blackbox tm

wallet, box, or case ... sized for credit cards and/or cigarettes
or ... snaps open // closed with the feel // action of a flip cell phone ... black or white ... patent pending [will only be offered, once we meet our $100k goal]

 fxband tm

silicone band sized for :: credit cards // folded cash vertically adding minimal bulk to your pocket, or fx currencies horizontally for your safety deposit box ... set of 3 includes one of each color :: black, 'rubber band' and off-white

 frenchwallet tm

for your more random encounters w//o embarrassment ... italian rubber :: faux fur ... sized for credit cards indiscreetly and condoms discreetly

 pillvial tm

for your daily meds w//o revealing a diagnosis ... sterling silver vial with handcuff clips ... 27.3 grams [weight] :: 1.4 in :: 38 mm [overall height] :: 0.6 in :: 1.5 cm [diameter opening]

 bottleglove tm

enhancing the frequency of random encounters w//o pretension ... minimalist sleeve for your wine, vodka, water ... stretch latex ... sized for 750 ml bottles

 boxerbrief tm

no logos, text or tags ... stop providing rent-free your most private real estate as a billboard for a brand ... strategic contoured seams ... softest quality cotton 90% :: elastane to keep its shape 10% ... black or white ... small, medium or large ... detachable card of authenticity of manufacturing, materials and care instructions

 delivery by Xmas :: perfect gift idea

our products are truly unique and instantly appreciated for their ingenuity alone.  our matchbox packaging is perfect for gifting.  many of you will actually cherish the packaging box and keep for other uses.  hence, we are selling the matchbox as a standalone product.  note the fxband and bottleglove are not packaged in these boxes.  still wondering what to get that special person who you think has everything ...

 please sir, i want some more

we realize you are design famished and in need ... to receive more than one perk, simply create additional contributions ... we apologize that the indiegogo system doesn't allow mutliple perks within one contribution. the 'you'll get nothing and like it' perk is really meant for people that want EVERYTHING on the menu, or a large combination of items. it's actually a quote from caddyshack.

 milestones

fortunately, we have many ideas ... unfortunately, not the funds to produce the entire line for launch.  all of the products have functional prototypes, which were perfected over the past 3 years ... all the designs are now prepared for manufacturing and the creation of inventory necessary to move forward efficiently.  the one exception is the blackbox.  we have perfected the protype, but have yet to tool the design for manufacturing.  tooling and manufacturing of the blackbox is an extremely expensive upfront cost.  therefore, we really need your help and are only able to offer the blackbox if we meet our $100k goal.

$100,000

  • 3% of contributions will be donated to Human Rights Campaign
  • your contributions will let us truly launch the entire line of products.

$500,000

  • 4% of contributions will be donated to Human Rights Campaign
  • only with contributions of 1/2 million dollars would i be able to recoup my initial financial investment ... and this would not even pay a penny towards the years of sweat equity ... and this is completely hypothetical, because i plan to reinvest the funds in the project ... this is a serious and committed endeavor ...  please do not let the artist within starve.

$1,000,000 [the true goal]

  • 5% of contributions will be donated to Human Rights Campaign
  • supporters will recieve a very special gift
  • the top 9 individuals with the most referrals and deemed most influencial, will recieve the entire line of products! for more information on how indiegogo tracks referrals click this link
  • each city around the globe which was a major participant, will have a celebratory party and our supporters will be our vip guests

 the plan

via a successful campaign we will be able to produce and stock our entire line.

the manufacturers are all in hand.  our new york team includes; jewelry, handbag, garment, plastic and rubber manufacturers.  all of the products have functional prototypes, which were perfected over the past 3 years.  a global fulfillment house is lined up for shipping, if it can't be handled in-house.

not knowing the total orders achievable via this medium, we are conservatively estimating production time at 3 months. inventory on all products can certainly be created and shipped within 2 months or less, but we are allowing extra time to ensure quality control. please keep in mind most of our manufacturers are local craftspeople normally working with designers and exclusive limited brands, not mass overseas producers. WE ARE PREPARED TO HANDLE ANY QUANTITY OF ORDERS!!!

 what makes us tick

manifesto
our underground effort applies creativity + passion to our daily routine, by producing minimalist 'daily essentials for the anti-conformist' tm.  with our design aesthetic, we are fighting visual pollution from the endless branding, product warnings and physique destroying bulk ... think of us as the anti-brand.

creativity + passion
our ideals infuse every aspect of our products and also the way we spread the word … we want to continue the success of softly marketing ourselves and treating people with dignity and respect.  we do not see you as sheep to be manipulated.  we are already planning our next film shoot and additionally, we have a great interest in endorsing all types of artistic mediums in the future.  we want to create for and be supported by creatives!!!  hopefully this project will start a movement ... erasing neighborhood destroying billboards, film interrupted advertising, blazing logos, price tags derived from marketing efforts, not quality. let's take back our lives.

our many layers
design  ::  minimalist . discreet . provocative . luxurious
engineering  ::  compact . structurally complex . functional
manufacturing  ::  quality driven . made in new york
marketing  ::  only with whispers
soul  ::  creative . connecting creatives . supporting creatives
responsible  ::  vegan . environmentally conscious
understanding ::  consciously simple . subconsciously influential

 my story [pierre]

i was never satisfied with the accessories on the market for many reasons.  perhaps, because i am detail obsessed ... many of you will likely relate to at least one of the drivers which led me to launch this product line.
 
love
  • design
  • quality
  • being discret, without changing who i am
  • being unique
dislike
  • bulk in my pockets
  • pretentious logos and labels
  • annoying tags
  • commercial advertising and blatant marketing
  • made in china
shopping list which was never resolved (until now)
  • key ring ... that's not annoying when wearing skinny jeans
  • daily bag ... androgynous, stylish, quality, unpretentious and fits my iPad
  • cigarette case/box ... camoflauged ... not drawing negative attention
  • money clip/band ... that's not flashy, pretentious, stupid, or cheap
  • underwear ... if calvin's not paying rent, my body's not another billboard
  • condom cover ... nothing worse than that circular indentation in one's wallet
  • pill case ... that's not flashy, pretentious, stupid, or cheap 
my do-it-yourself attitude
 
working in architecture and real estate development, i have always created projects from scratch.  i am passionate about the process.  this project is certainly different, but there are parallels in the design process ... just that it's to the smallest detail.
 
helmut newton's influence
 
i've always been inspired by helmut newton's photography and i realize a lot of inspiration was drawn from his photographs when developing the designs of the product line.  imagine if helmut newton had to design accessories for muji.  hence the short film's inspiration as well.
 
 
aggressive marketing makes me nauceous
 
when i set out to create the boX brand, i wanted to do it my way.  somewhat like an anti-brand that could get not-for-profit religious tax status.  somehow that led into making a creative short film about a cat thief stealing my products.  extrememly subtle and hopefully entertaining.  i did not want to get the word out via typical marketing strategies, which would make me puke ... if you don't like what you do, why do it???  sidenote: i don't own a tv, as i cannot justify the interruptions of commercials (exception is the super bowl sunday).
 
once i had the initial prototype made, i decided to throw caution to the wind and create some art!  i wanted to start building a feeling for my brand. i engaged my friend olivier french who is a film maker and owns viral cinema studio.  the result was 'black box'. the product was featured in a very subtle way.
 
smells like art ... 'black box' our erotic film noir short, was an official selection at the cannes film festival in 2011 and at the la jolla fashion film festival in 2012.
 
detail obsessed
 
countless designs and many very expensive prototypes later the entire line is finally ready to launch ... 3 years to achieve perfection.  the designs needed to be approved by the helmut newton in my head and worthy of the boX cat burgalr to steal.
 
early design drawings and mood boards
 
 
... and thus began my little fantasy range of products ... NOW I NEED YOUR HELP TO ACTUALLY MAKE IT HAPPEN ... after all i think that there is a little helmut newton in all of us.

 msg from [pierre] ... thank you!!!

i have my designs, dreams, hard work and life savings invested ... but nothing could have happened working alone ...

boX will become successful thanks to all you trend-setting early adapters!!!  

i send a very special thank you to all who supported the major effort behind this 3 year project, helping perfect the simplest of products ... simple in final form, but complex in terms of design, artistic and philosophical layers. it has been an incredibly creative & rewarding journey already, which deserves to continue with accelerated momentum.  it would not be, what it has become, without the involvement of ::

OLIVIER FRENCH : Michael Nelson : tony notarberardino : yael abbey : erinn ruth : shahnee zaver : yanni feder : steve ovenden : patrick cannell : jill lenoir : elise laporte : kathy cherry : lora gheysen : cynthia kummer : catherine mix : sophie willing : steven keating : rick librizzi  : joel diamond : gene hale : steve fuller : joseph postiglione : james hicken : ben cohen : kathleen lopez : jeff frummess : perry levy : steve tollen : andrew morse : jonathan gray : ray oliveira : raymond mclaren : hector simancas : dimitrios krikelis : eirini tsachrelia : dna model management : fushion model management : heather janey : susan batson studio : jasper sceats : roberta wallach : greg loibl : josiah hobson : rick lehrer : sabrina piccione : rodolphe lombard : dionisio cortes : matt dobbs : sarah moessner : romina frecha : scott reed : nissa botthoff : samuel ferrati

the underdog will finally have a voice!!!

 connections

  • share (y)our creative ideas on FACEBOOK [share our campaign on facebook for a chance to win the product of your choice]
  • undress your thoughts with us on TUMBLR
  • please guide us through the sea of s%^t on TWITTER towards your genius
  • connect on pinterest, behance or instagram for inspiration

we envision a chain reaction of connections will occur if you personally share this campaign.  your friends will surely thank you for the introduction.
