story:
A Design Project by Violeta Villacorta

We have created a Follow-up Campaign to continue raising the funds needed to achieve our mission successfully.

We invite you to visit www.indiegogo.com/Saving-the-Amazon-1-Seed-at-a-time to Contribute and share the link through your resources.


Thank you!

 

••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••

 

Thanks again to all who contributed! Although we didn't reach our goal, the money we raised will help our work:

~ In purchasing and shipping the gifts you selected.

~ Continue internet communication for the Cofán through the rest of the year, which saves them from traveling to the nearest city and allows them to continue their business without delays.

~ Purchase a computer, camera and eyeglasses for the Awajún artisans.

~ and hopefully it will go a longer way...

For all who have messaged that you would still like to contribute, you can make a tax-deductible contribution by visiting http://orgbyvio.com/donate for details or visit https://amazonwatch.org/donate, in Additional Comments write “VIOLETA’S AMAZON PROJECT” and send me a message to track your contribution.

Amazon Watch acts as an umbrella for our work and collects funds on our behalf for our ongoing projects with indigenous Amazon artisans and communities.

Visit our online shop @ http://orgbyvio.com to purchase fine eco jewelry and fashion from the talented Amazon artisans we work with!

You can also invest in our sustainable Amazon eco fashion vision, as a means to generate a sustainable economy for the stewards of the forests, the protection of their culture and territories vital to our own survival.

For the Love of People, Planet & Culture.

Thank you all!

Much Love & Light ♥

 
We work on creative design projects in collaboration with indigenous communities in the Amazon to promote their ancestral artistry, incorporating their traditional work into contemporary designs, as a means to generate a sustainable economy for the stewards of the most biodiverse ecosystem.
 
This is a great opportunity for you to support our work in the Amazon, pick up some beautiful rewards from the artisans we work with, and be a part of our project to protect the rainforest and the rich cultures and people that inhabit the Amazon through design!
 

WHY WE NEED YOUR SUPPORT

  • We are still in the growing stages of our work and we want you to be a part of it!
  • Indigenous peoples working with us are looking for alternatives to extractive industries, as the world benefits best from the rainforest - the lungs and climate regulator of our planet - by leaving it standing and its cultures having the choice to remain as stewards of the forests.
  • A viable venue for their work helps the artisans cultivate and pass down their artistry to the youth, which encourages them to stay in their communities.
  • To supply artisans with laptops, internet service and printers, drilling tools, camera & eyeglasses. The Awajún lost their communitations tower to heavy weather a few years ago and we plan to replace it, so they don't have to travel by boat or car for many hours to the nearest town for basic communication for their community needs and the needs of the artisans.
  • To purchase larger amounts of production units from the current artisans we work with and the new communities waiting to work with us.
  • Trade shows are costly and we need to participate in important shows to place the artisans' work in the right stores.
  • To optimize ORGbyvio.com's online presence and ensure our online store sells directly to customers globally.
  • To reach more people around the globe with beautiful eco fashion from the Amazon rainforest handmade by talented indigenous artisans and ensure a sustainable economy for the stewards of the forests.


HOW MUCH IS NEEDED?

We have set our goal to $20,000 for this phase of our work outlined above. However, the total amount needed to accomplish our ongoing work is upward of $100,000. Your contribution will help achieve this larger goal.

When you contribute, note that part of it will be used to pay for and ship your selected reward. Also, Indiegogo gets 4% of total money raised, if we reach our goal and 9% if we don't, and a payment processing fee of 2-3% will be charged.


WHAT YOU GET FOR YOUR SUPPORT

Aside from playing a big part in our project, you pick up beautiful rewards, if you select that option when you contribute. There are a number of levels of support. Any amount contributed is helpful in meeting our goal. We are grateful for all your love and support!

All Rewards are listed on the right and photos are included below, so scroll down to see all your options! Everyone who contributes from $10 and up will be listed as a supporter and funder on our website, and you will be included in our supporters album with a photo you submit, unless you choose otherwise.

See the beautiful items you will receive for your contribution below or in the Gallery tab above under images.



Asociación Sukû Artisans of Cofán Dureno, Ecuadorian Amazon.

In 2010, I began working with Cofán community artisans of Asociación Sukû in the Ecuadorian Amazon to share traditional Cofán artistry and culture and act as a bridge between the artisans, their artistry and markets. Asociacón Sukû is an organization made up of over 40 highly talented women artisans, whose mission is to contribute and improve social, economic and cultural development of their members and the community, strengthening their cultural and spiritual identity through projects in agriculture, forestry, arts and crafts, and protection of the rainforest. This initial work with Cofán artisans evolved into the brand ORG by vio®.

 

ORG stands for Organic Rainforest Goods and spells GRO backwards; by vio is an acronym for Violeta and Indigenous Organizations.  ORG by vio® was created as an umbrella for promoting Amazon culture, protection of the rainforest and selling handmade jewelry and accessories made by indigenous Amazon artisans. We work in partnership with artisans in the Amazon to share their traditional artistry and develop designer collections of eco fashion made with rainforest materials as a source for a sustainable economy. It is an honor to work with such prolific artisans who are inspired to share their work and culture with the world.

Our work includes: trainings; purchasing artisans' traditional crafts and collections we co-develop together up front; buying materials and production tools for the artisans; supplying them with laptops and internet to communicate, so they can receive their product orders via email and place Skype calls, as well as to utilize these tools to share their culture and events directly via the internet; paying for artisans' expenses when attending exhibits and fairs; helping the artisans open bank accounts for their associations, which facilitate their financial transactions; et cetera. In addition ORG by vio® shares 50% of profits with artisans and/or their communities through projects that enhance their livelihood while maintaining their cultural identity. Visit orgbyvio.com/projects to learn more.

Although, the preceding states what ORG by vio® does, NOTE further down what the funds will be used for in this particular phase of our work.

Deep in Forests network, Perú.

In 2011 I became a member of the Deep in Forests network in Perú. Deep in Forests is a partnership of indigenous leaders and entrepreneurs working together to create sustainable solutions for the protection of the rainforest and cultures that have been stewards of the Amazon for centuries. Deep in Forests connected me with other Amazon community members and thus I began working with Awajún artisans in the Peruvian rainforest in mid 2011. The Awajún Artisans' Women’s Association of the Nor-Orient Awajún Region (AMRNA) is made up of over 50 highly talented women artisans dedicated to their arts and culture.


Awajún Artisans' Women’s Association of the Nor-Orient Awajún Region (AMRNA) in Urakusa, Peruvian Amazon.

Most indigenous Amazon communities like the Awajún, although they are a contacted people, live in remote areas where they get no visitors and are unable to sell their beautiful work. ORG by vio® is committed to the artisans in bringing their work to the rest of the world.

 
Click left photo to see Asociación Sukû Collection on YouTube & on right photo to see Awajún Collection on YouTube or watch in Gallery tab above.

As we continue our work with Asociación Sukû in Ecuador and Awajún artisans in Perú, other Amazon communities have contacted us to work with them. This has taken ORG by vio® to a new level and we need your support to make this happen. To do our work with more needed funds and continue our current collaboration with extisting communities while gradually and systematically adding new communities.

REWARDS

Four Amazon Rainforest Wallpapers for your iPhone $10+

For $10 or more, you receive 4 Wallpapers for your iPhone featuring beautiful nature images from the Amazon rainforest.


Cofán or Awajún Unisex Bracelet $25+

For $25 or more, you receive a Cofán or Awajún Unisex Bracelet handmade with rainforest seeds by Asociación Sukû artisans from the Ecuadorian Amazon or Awajún Artisans from the Peruvian Amazon.


Awajún Beaded Necklace $50+

For $50 or more, you receive an Awajún Beaded Necklace handmade with rainforest seeds by Awajún artisans from the Peruvian Amazon. The red and black colors of the huayruro seed symbolize good fortune and abundance, as well as balance.


Cofán Beaded Necklace $75+


Cofán Kango Triple Beaded Necklace $75+
For $75 or more, you receive a gorgeous Cofán Beaded Necklace or a Cofán Kango Triple Beaded Necklace handmade with rainforest seeds by Asociación Sukû artisans from the Ecuadorian Amazon.


Amazon Shoulder Bag $100+

For $100 or more, you receive a gorgeous Cofán Shigra Bag handmade with chambira plant fiber and dyed with plant dyes by Asociación Sukû artisans from the Ecuadorian Rainforest...
OR a Unisex Awajún Wanpash Bag
Handmade by Awajún artisans in the Peruvian Rainforest. Chambira plant fiber is hand stripped and rolled into twine, then woven into this beautiful bag. Colors are achieved with plant dyes. See Ashaninka Shoulder Bag below from our Deep in Forests partner Ecotribal for a third option. Each bag is unique, you will receive one similar to photos.


Awajún Beaded Chichao Necklace $125+



OR an Awajún Beaded Woven Necklace $125+
For $125 or more, you receive a gorgeous Awajún Woven Necklace or an exquisite Awajún Chichao Necklace handmade with rainforest seeds by Awajún artisans from the Peruvian Amazon.


Awajún Etsa or Enkepa Beaded Necklace $175+

For $175 or more, you receive a stunning Awajún Etsa Beaded Necklace handmade with rainforest seeds by Awajún artisans from the Peruvian Amazon. Etsa means Sun in Awajún...
Or Awajún Enkepa Necklace in Black Seeds
A striking Awajún Enkepa Necklace in Black handmade with rainforest seeds by Awajún artisans from the Peruvian Amazon...
Or Awajún Enkepa Necklace in Natural & Black Seeds
Gorgeous Awajún Enkepa Necklace in Black & Natural handmade with rainforest seeds by Awajún artisans from the Peruvian Amazon...
Or Awajún Enkepa Necklace in Saffron Seeds
Gorgeous Awajún Enkepa Necklace in Saffron handmade with rainforest seeds by Awajún artisans from the Peruvian Amazon...
Or Awajún Enkepa Necklace in Multicolor Beads
Awajún Enkepa Necklace in Multicolor handmade with color beads by Awajún artisans from the Peruvian rainforest.


Cofán Hammock $300+

For $300 or more, you receive a beautiful Cofán Hammock handmade by Cofán artisans from the Ecuadorian rainforest. Chambira fiber is hand picked, dried, stripped and rolled into twine. Colors are dyed with plant colors. It takes over one month by a talented artisan to create the beautiful intricacy of the Cofan Hammock.
10 Available.


SK1 Knife Sage Blades $650+

For $650 or more, you receive this beautiful SK1 Knife by Sage Blades, the perfect bush tool for the jungle or camping. Handcrafted with O1 Tool Steel in a micro-peened finish and a leather-cord handle-wrap with a kydex sheath.
10 Available.

Sage Blades is the product of knife designer and maker Dylan Farnham, whose attention to detail, function and beauty combine to make the perfect cutting tools that can be passed from generation to generation. All Sage Blades knives and tools come with a lifetime warranty.

Sage Blades has been invited by the men in the Awajún community of Urakusa in the Peruvian Amazon, to give a workshop and teach them how to make their own knives from found metal, which ORG by vio® will sponsor. www.sageblades.com.

Rewards from our Deep in Forests partners

Yanesha Bowl PaTS $245+

For $245 or more, you receive a Yanesha Bowl. 25 Available.
Or...
A Yanesha Bowl with Handles hand carved with wood from managed forests by Yanesha artisans from the Peruvian rainforest, from PaTS. 25 Available.

PaTS stands for Partnership and Technology for Sustainability. "PATS means EARTH in the YANESHA dialect. PaTS has twelve years working in the Palcazu Valley, in the Central Peruvian Amazon, with  the Yanesha ethnic group as partners, in five Native Communities along this exquisitely beautiful lush valley.

PaTS program increases the value of one tree, from US$30 to $1,800 of economic sustenance for the forest inhabitants.  This allows them not to have to harvest many trees to live sustainably, and allows for their forests to be managed easily.  Only two trees per hectare were harvested, on average, last year, 2011.

Artisans are able to work in their own home.  We aim to keep them employed only three weeks a month, so they may also tend their farms and live their family lives.  PATS is a Peruvian non-profit organization still receiving financial sponsorship from foundations until sales reach a Sustainability break even volume, forecasted to be reached by the end of 2013. www.patsperu.org

Click on photo to watch PaTS video on YouTube or watch in the Gallery tab above.

Traditional Ashaninka Cushma Robe Ecotribal $350+

For $350+ you receive this traditional Ashaninka cotton robe, or cushma, woven by Ashaninka women for the men of their tribe. The organic cotton is grown in small forest gardens within the Peruvian Amazon rainforest.

Dyed with plant dyes, Cushmas are an Ashaninka's most prized possession and there is a very long tradition of giving and exchanging cushmas and cloth with nyomparis (or trading partners), which linked distant Ashaninka villages into cycles of meetings, collaboration and resource sharing. Each Cushma is unique. Yours will be similar to the one pictured above.
5 Available.


Ashaninka Shoulder Bag Ecotribal $100


For $100 or more, you receive an Ashaninka Shoulder Bag from Ecotribal. Made from organic cotton fibers and natural plant dyes in a white, brown and black striped pattern with single strap. Each bag is unique. Yours will be similar to the one above.
10 Available.

Ecotribal's basic mission is to collaborate with indigenous peoples in a way that provides them with an income from sustainable products that support their culture and autonomy as well as territorial and environmental integrity.

Ecotribal has been established in 2004 after a long period of gestation, including 28 years traveling and working in South America, accumulating experience in anthropology, sustainable development, teaching, tourism and journalism. This work has led to strong direct links to rainforest communities, particularly in the Peruvian Amazon. www.ecotribal.com


Tambopata Research Center, Rainforest Expeditions $1,500+
Click on Parrot Clay Lick photo below to watch on YouTube or watch in the Gallery tab above.

For $1,500 or more, you receive an expedition at Tambopata Research Center from Deep in Forests partner Rainforest Expeditions. 6 days/5 nights. TRC has been working with macaws for over 20 years. A huge claylick lays less than a kilometer from TRC.
Photos by Jeff Cremer.
Airfare not included.

Rainforest Expeditions is a recipient of The Rainforest Alliance 2012 Sustainable Standard-Setter award. This Peruvian ecotourism company shares with visitors in a sustainable manner the miracles of the Tambopata-Candamo Reserved Zone, 1.5 million hectares of pristine, still wild, tropical rainforest encompassing an area of land the size of Connecticut and stretching from the Andean highlands to the Amazon lowlands. It includes the Tambopata National Reserve, a 275,000-hectare conservation unit created by the Peruvian government in 1990 to protect the watersheds of the Tambopata and Candamo rivers. It is adjacent to the 1-million-hectare Bahuaja Sonene National Park. Conservation and ecotourism is helping to protect some of the last untouched lowland and premontane tropical humid forests in the Amazon.

Since 1989, guests of first one and now three Rainforest Expedition eco-lodges have added value to the region’s standing tropical rainforest. A sensitively conceived and managed (in some cases by native communities) touristic infrastructure creates a competitive alternative to such unsustainable economic uses as clear cutting the forest for timber or for cattle grazing. The partnerships Rainforest Expeditions has forged with local people eager to share Amazonian traditions with guests provide connection, expertise, adventure and access to wildlife in the jungles of Tambopata. Rainforest Expeditions has been verified and certified “a sustainable tourism business” by the Rainforest Alliance. www.perunature.com

By supporting ORG by vio® and the indigenous Amazon artisans on Indiegogo, you will be helping us reach our goal to bring high quality Amazon accessories and eco fashion to more people around the world, while ensuring a sustainable economy for the stewards of the forests...  And you will receive gorgeous rewards made by the very artisans you are supporting!

PLEDGES ARE ACCEPTED WORLDWIDE in USD!

If you rather receive a tax write-off for a contribution above $100, please visit www.amazonwatch.org and donate, in Additional Comments write “VIOLETA’S AMAZON PROJECT” ...Or send a tax-deductible contribution to Amazon Watch 221 Pine St., 4th Floor, San Francisco, CA 94104 and write “VIOLETA’S AMAZON PROJECT” on memo. Send me a message, if you've chosen this option, so we can track it.


Other ways to support:

If you would like to invest in ORG by vio® and our work with Amazon artisans, send me a message or visit our Investing page.

You can also Shop for beautiful Amazon Eco Fashions directly on our online Shop!

If you are media or PR, you can promote our company and work through your mediums! You can read more about us in About menu on our website, in Press and watch our videos.


Please support this project!
Even small contributions mean a lot to us. If you know someone who might also be interested in supporting ORG by vio® and the Amazon artisans, please let them know and pass this fundraiser along. Thank you so much for your help and support!

And thank you to the artisans and Deep in Forests partners for sharing their exquisite Amazon goods for this project!

For the Love of People, Planet & Culture.

Love & Light,


Founder & Designer
ORG by vio®

orgbyvio.com
violetavillacorta.com
youtube.com
twitter.com
facebook.com
linkedin.com
story_txt:
A Design Project by Violeta Villacorta

We have created a Follow-up Campaign to continue raising the funds needed to achieve our mission successfully.
We invite you to visit www.indiegogo.com/Saving-the-Amazon-1-Seed-at-a-time to Contribute and share the link through your resources.
Thank you!
 
••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••
 


Thanks again to all who contributed! Although we didn't reach our goal, the money we raised will help our work: ~ In purchasing and shipping the gifts you selected. ~ Continue internet communication for the Cofán through the rest of the year, which saves them from traveling to the nearest city and allows them to continue their business without delays. ~ Purchase a computer, camera and eyeglasses for the Awajún artisans. ~ and hopefully it will go a longer way...

For all who have messaged that you would still like to contribute, you can make a tax-deductible contribution by visiting http://orgbyvio.com/donate for details or visit https://amazonwatch.org/donate, in Additional Comments write “VIOLETA’S AMAZON PROJECT” and send me a message to track your contribution.

Amazon Watch acts as an umbrella for our work and collects funds on our behalf for our ongoing projects with indigenous Amazon artisans and communities.
Visit our online shop @ http://orgbyvio.com to purchase fine eco jewelry and fashion from the talented Amazon artisans we work with!
You can also invest in our sustainable Amazon eco fashion vision, as a means to generate a sustainable economy for the stewards of the forests, the protection of their culture and territories vital to our own survival.
For the Love of People, Planet & Culture.
Thank you all!
Much Love & Light ♥

 
We work on creative design projects in collaboration with indigenous communities in the Amazon to promote their ancestral artistry, incorporating their traditional work into contemporary designs, as a means to generate a sustainable economy for the stewards of the most biodiverse ecosystem.
 
This is a great opportunity for you to support our work in the Amazon, pick up some beautiful rewards from the artisans we work with, and be a part of our project to protect the rainforest and the rich cultures and people that inhabit the Amazon through design!
 

WHY WE NEED YOUR SUPPORT


We are still in the growing stages of our work and we want you to be a part of it!



Indigenous peoples working with us are looking for alternatives to extractive industries, as the world benefits best from the rainforest - the lungs and climate regulator of our planet - by leaving it standing and its cultures having the choice to remain as stewards of the forests.



A viable venue for their work helps the artisans cultivate and pass down their artistry to the youth, which encourages them to stay in their communities.



To supply artisans with laptops, internet service and printers, drilling tools, camera & eyeglasses. The Awajún lost their communitations tower to heavy weather a few years ago and we plan to replace it, so they don't have to travel by boat or car for many hours to the nearest town for basic communication for their community needs and the needs of the artisans.



To purchase larger amounts of production units from the current artisans we work with and the new communities waiting to work with us.



Trade shows are costly and we need to participate in important shows to place the artisans' work in the right stores.



To optimize ORGbyvio.com's online presence and ensure our online store sells directly to customers globally.



To reach more people around the globe with beautiful eco fashion from the Amazon rainforest handmade by talented indigenous artisans and ensure a sustainable economy for the stewards of the forests.

HOW MUCH IS NEEDED?
We have set our goal to $20,000 for this phase of our work outlined above. However, the total amount needed to accomplish our ongoing work is upward of $100,000. Your contribution will help achieve this larger goal.When you contribute, note that part of it will be used to pay for and ship your selected reward. Also, Indiegogo gets 4% of total money raised, if we reach our goal and 9% if we don't, and a payment processing fee of 2-3% will be charged.
WHAT YOU GET FOR YOUR SUPPORT
Aside from playing a big part in our project, you pick up beautiful rewards, if you select that option when you contribute. There are a number of levels of support. Any amount contributed is helpful in meeting our goal. We are grateful for all your love and support!
All Rewards are listed on the right and photos are included below, so scroll down to see all your options! Everyone who contributes from $10 and up will be listed as a supporter and funder on our website, and you will be included in our supporters album with a photo you submit, unless you choose otherwise.
See the beautiful items you will receive for your contribution below or in the Gallery tab above under images.

Asociación Sukû Artisans of Cofán Dureno, Ecuadorian Amazon.
In 2010, I began working with Cofán community artisans of Asociación Sukû in the Ecuadorian Amazon to share traditional Cofán artistry and culture and act as a bridge between the artisans, their artistry and markets. Asociacón Sukû is an organization made up of over 40 highly talented women artisans, whose mission is to contribute and improve social, economic and cultural development of their members and the community, strengthening their cultural and spiritual identity through projects in agriculture, forestry, arts and crafts, and protection of the rainforest. This initial work with Cofán artisans evolved into the brand ORG by vio®.

  ORG stands for Organic Rainforest Goods and spells GRO backwards; by vio is an acronym for Violeta and Indigenous Organizations.  ORG by vio® was created as an umbrella for promoting Amazon culture, protection of the rainforest and selling handmade jewelry and accessories made by indigenous Amazon artisans. We work in partnership with artisans in the Amazon to share their traditional artistry and develop designer collections of eco fashion made with rainforest materials as a source for a sustainable economy. It is an honor to work with such prolific artisans who are inspired to share their work and culture with the world.
Our work includes: trainings; purchasing artisans' traditional crafts and collections we co-develop together up front; buying materials and production tools for the artisans; supplying them with laptops and internet to communicate, so they can receive their product orders via email and place Skype calls, as well as to utilize these tools to share their culture and events directly via the internet; paying for artisans' expenses when attending exhibits and fairs; helping the artisans open bank accounts for their associations, which facilitate their financial transactions; et cetera. In addition ORG by vio® shares 50% of profits with artisans and/or their communities through projects that enhance their livelihood while maintaining their cultural identity. Visit orgbyvio.com/projects to learn more.Although, the preceding states what ORG by vio® does, NOTE further down what the funds will be used for in this particular phase of our work.

Deep in Forests network, Perú.
In 2011 I became a member of the Deep in Forests network in Perú. Deep in Forests is a partnership of indigenous leaders and entrepreneurs working together to create sustainable solutions for the protection of the rainforest and cultures that have been stewards of the Amazon for centuries. Deep in Forests connected me with other Amazon community members and thus I began working with Awajún artisans in the Peruvian rainforest in mid 2011. The Awajún Artisans' Women’s Association of the Nor-Orient Awajún Region (AMRNA) is made up of over 50 highly talented women artisans dedicated to their arts and culture.
Awajún Artisans' Women’s Association of the Nor-Orient Awajún Region (AMRNA) in Urakusa, Peruvian Amazon.
Most indigenous Amazon communities like the Awajún, although they are a contacted people, live in remote areas where they get no visitors and are unable to sell their beautiful work. ORG by vio® is committed to the artisans in bringing their work to the rest of the world.   Click left photo to see Asociación Sukû Collection on YouTube & on right photo to see Awajún Collection on YouTube or watch in Gallery tab above.
As we continue our work with Asociación Sukû in Ecuador and Awajún artisans in Perú, other Amazon communities have contacted us to work with them. This has taken ORG by vio® to a new level and we need your support to make this happen. To do our work with more needed funds and continue our current collaboration with extisting communities while gradually and systematically adding new communities.

Awajún Enkepa Necklace in Multicolor handmade with color beads by Awajún artisans from the Peruvian rainforest.

Colors are dyed with plant colors. It takes over one month by a talented artisan to create the beautiful intricacy of the Cofan Hammock.10 Available.

Sage Blades is the product of knife designer and maker Dylan Farnham, whose attention to detail, function and beauty combine to make the perfect cutting tools that can be passed from generation to generation. All Sage Blades knives and tools come with a lifetime warranty.Sage Blades has been invited by the men in the Awajún community of Urakusa in the Peruvian Amazon, to give a workshop and teach them how to make their own knives from found metal, which ORG by vio® will sponsor. www.sageblades.com.

A Yanesha Bowl with Handles hand carved with wood from managed forests by Yanesha artisans from the Peruvian rainforest, from PaTS. 25 Available.

story:
Short Summary

We are looking for financial support to take a team of 6 fashion creatives (5 UK, 1 Iceland) for a week long couture, editorial photo shoot in Iceland. The collaborative shoot aims to showcase couture-style designs, inspired by Imperial Russia and Fabergé Eggs, and present them in the dramatic and diverse landscapes of Iceland. 

The Designer

Christopher Niari is an aspiring Fashion designer from the North East of England. He is self-taught and has been practicing in Fashion for 7 years. He has also been providing a bespoke commission service for 3 years, specialising in tailoring and corsetry. He draws his inspiration from the world of Haute Couture and designers such as Christian Dior, Thierry Mugler, Alexander McQueen and John Galliano.

Christopher's work can be seen at: www.facebook.com/ChristopherNiari

The Photographer

Richard Powazynski is an internationally published fashion photographer also from the North East of England. He began his work in photography shooting solely landscapes while travelling overseas, but found his passion for editorial and high fashion photography on his return to the UK. Richard has a preference for working in a team to produce fashion images that also draw on his experience and expertise with shooting outstanding landscapes and interesting locations. He takes inspiration from the work of photographers such as Patrick Demarchelier and Paolo Roversi.

Richard's work can be seen at: www.richardpowazynski.com

The Team

Besides Christopher and Richard, the team consists of talented creative individuals, carefully selected to enhance the outcome of the final editorial.

A hair and make-up artist has been selected due to his ability to create beautiful looks to compliment the outfits and concept. His work has caught the attention of both Illamasqua and MAC gaining him sponsorship from one and employment from the other.

Two models will be sporting 3 of the designs each over the course of the shoot. One model is coming along with the team from the UK, while the other model is from Iceland   and will be able to help guide us around her home country.

There will also be an assistant coming along on the project to help out with all photography, dressing and preparation needs.

Inspiration Behind the Concept & Designs

Inspiration for the 6 designs has been taken from Imperial Fabergé Eggs commissioned by the Romanov's, the last ruling family of Imperial Russia. Having visited Russia and having a love for the allure of Russian opulence and the Romanov Dynasty, Christopher chose the Imperial Eggs, crafted by the House of Fabergé in Paris, for their representation of the wealth, power and decadence displayed by the Russian aristocrats and royalty of that era.

The six outfits will be inspired by Christopher's favourite Eggs; the silhouettes of each look will be heavily influenced by the Dior 'New Look' of 1947 (padded hips, corseted waist and rounded shoulders). Christian Dior himself had a fascination with Russia, so marrying the Dior silhouette with Fabergé Egg embellishment seems appropriate, especially with the heavy Russian links and association with wealth and effortless luxury.


Location  

Our chosen location for the shoot is Iceland. This is due to the country's diverse landscape and breathtaking natural beauty which Richard will be able to use to his advantage. The similarities between some areas of the Icelandic countryside and the Siberian tundra also make it a prime location to create the editorial with an extra Russian element. Iceland was also chosen due to its ease of access from the UK; the lack of having to apply for Visas and the extra added expenses required to shoot in Russia benefits both the team and the costs involved with the project.

Iceland's general infrastructure, namely the 'Route 1' ring road allows easy access to many locations of outstanding natural beauty and diversity. With the aid of a camper van we can easily travel throughout the country, staying on the road instead of having to return to a 'base camp' such as a hotel or other static accommodation. This gives our team many options regarding location choice while also provides a varied backdrop throughout the complete set of all 6 outfits.

Our Plans and Requirements

The dates our whole team has set aside to conduct the project is from Wednesday 5th - Wednesday 12th February 2014, flying from Manchester International Airport to Reykjavik International Airport (Wednesday flights from Manchester is the cheapest option). Upon arrival, the camper van will be picked up from Reykjavik and the journey will begin. The photo shoots will commence on the Thursday and will continue through until the evening of the following Tuesday.

The money achieved through this campaign will go towards paying for all 5 required  return flights from the UK to Iceland, Camper van hire and insurance and petrol to cover the approximate 1,339 kilometre round journey via the 'Route 1' ring road. It will also go towards the cost for the embellishments needed for the designs to create an authentic 'Fabergé Egg' feel; freshwater pearls, Swarovski crystals and fine gold and silver chains are among the required embellishments. All the fabrics such as the tailoring and corsetry supplies and fashion fabrics like Duchess Satin, Faux Fur and Embroidery Tulle are already being amassed using the designer's own personal funds.

All members of the team have agreed to work free of charge, making the project purely for art and collaborative purposes in which all of our collective creative skills can be appreciated.

A Bit About the Perks

The perks that we will be offering are unique and exclusive strictly to the individuals who fund this project. No additional merchandise or products of any kind will be made after the completion of this project. All funders will be acknowledged on various social media platforms and websites owned and used by the team as thanks for your involvement... without you there would simply be no project!

The smaller perks ranging from donations of £5 to £50 are all tokens for your support and investment in the project. Perks from £100+ are strictly limited and are designed to make larger donations more rewarding and closely related to the project.

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand that not all supporters have the ability to donate financially, however to show your support we would appreciate helping us get the word out about our project. 

Another great way you could help is to use the Indiegogo share tools.
story_txt:
Short Summary

We are looking for financial support to take a team of 6 fashion creatives (5 UK, 1 Iceland) for a week long couture, editorial photo shoot in Iceland. The collaborative shoot aims to showcase couture-style designs, inspired by Imperial Russia and Fabergé Eggs, and present them in the dramatic and diverse landscapes of Iceland. 
The Designer
Christopher Niari is an aspiring Fashion designer from the North East of England. He is self-taught and has been practicing in Fashion for 7 years. He has also been providing a bespoke commission service for 3 years, specialising in tailoring and corsetry. He draws his inspiration from the world of Haute Couture and designers such as Christian Dior, Thierry Mugler, Alexander McQueen and John Galliano.
Christopher's work can be seen at: www.facebook.com/ChristopherNiari




The Photographer

Richard Powazynski is an internationally published fashion photographer also from the North East of England. He began his work in photography shooting solely landscapes while travelling overseas, but found his passion for editorial and high fashion photography on his return to the UK. Richard has a preference for working in a team to produce fashion images that also draw on his experience and expertise with shooting outstanding landscapes and interesting locations. He takes inspiration from the work of photographers such as Patrick Demarchelier and Paolo Roversi.
Richard's work can be seen at: www.richardpowazynski.com





The Team

Besides Christopher and Richard, the team consists of talented creative individuals, carefully selected to enhance the outcome of the final editorial.
A hair and make-up artist has been selected due to his ability to create beautiful looks to compliment the outfits and concept. His work has caught the attention of both Illamasqua and MAC gaining him sponsorship from one and employment from the other.

story:
Sustainable and durable playwear


About Us

We are the parents of two lively kids, Vincent- 4 1/2 and Lilly 3. They are very energetic and we constantly drag them outdoors to play in the snow, in the forest, on the beach, in the garden, etc. We got frustrated that none of their clothes withstood the games they played. It didn’t take long before their clothing was torn or ripped. Also we were amazed with the poor fit of some clothes. A lot of them are designed to expose their lower back as soon as they are not standing at attention. We needed to find clothes for our kids to play in. We couldn’t find any.

We also want to question how things are done in the industry and to show customers another way, to challenge peoples ”buy and throw” culture. We are a small company and we are avoiding the big company systems of doing things. Mass-production, lead times, and the retail thinking made us realize that this is not how we want to do and be in business. 

We have worked in the outdoor apparel business for about a decade. Even though we have been part of fantastic products, it has always been a compromise between product quality and production price. Get a cheaper fabric, get rid of one pocket, we need to sell x amount to be able to get the price down. 

We began to question and had to rethink the traditional cycles of development, production and distribution. We want to make honest products with no compromises. Get the best materials we can afford, work with the best manufacturers and the best suppliers, and all this in a sustainable manner. We want the customer to know where the product has been made and with what materials. 

The fast paced mass-production industry was not something we wanted to be a part of. Usually in all retail clothing companies most of the markup goes to the middlemen, the retailers, and to the big corporation that has to satisfy its shareholders. We want to put you, the end customer, first. We want to invest back in the company, making the best products possible. 


What We Do

We make durable and sustainable unisex apparel for kids to play in. Clothes that are comfortable, practical, stylish and last when the kids are running, sliding, skateboarding, or just being kids.

We are kicking off Alice & Ted with a pant, a long-sleeved t-shirt and a t-shirt. However we have more garments designed and lined up to be added to the collection. There are large costs associated with purchasing fabric, producing the garments, and size adjusting the patterns. Therefore we take things one step at a time. We don’t want to compromize the quality of the products.

We need your help to get this project started. Please support us to make this happen!


Sustainability

It is important that we leave the earth in a good condition for our kids so they can pass it on to the next generation in their turn. Today our earth is in deep need of more friends and we want to do as much as possible to do as little damage as we can on this planet. That's why sustainability is very important for us. We want our children and their children to be able to enjoy our fantastic nature as much as we enjoy it now.

Ethical Production

We choose carefully the partners we like to work with. Not only are our co-workers people we like working with, but they share our view on environmental consciousness. We have an overview of the entire production, from fabric production to transportation of final garment to customer. We have all our suppliers close to us in Europe and they share our view on ethical production. 

Reduce the Need to Consume

The basic concept of Alice & Ted is to make durable clothes. We choose durable fabrics and material and design the garments with e.g. reinforcements to make them last a long time. We want the clothes to be used for years and hopefully passed on to younger kids. By using quality clothes that last longer, the need to consume reduces.

Minimizing Waste

First hand, Alice & Ted buys fabric that is overproduced. That means it is leftover from other productions and just laying on a shelf in storage. If it is absolutely impossible to find a desired quality, then we produce a new, environmentally friendly material.

Organic / Recycled / Certified

We only use materials that are environmenally certified and/or organic and/or recycled or and/or biodegradable.


What We Need & What You Get

We need your support so we can produce a first batch of our sustainable Play Pant, Polar Bear Longsleeve, and Panda Tee to sell it online. Our clothes will be available online and we'll ship all over the world.

By supporting us you will get the rewards presented to the right, from a thank you message to becoming the first ones to receive our clothes.

By supporting us you also help us get started with a full range of durable and sustainable clothes for children.

After you support us, we would love if you helped spread the word. Email, Facebook, Twitter, blogs - whatever you prefer.


Our Products

Once we get started with Alice & Ted we will as soon as we can expand the collection to a full range of playwear for kids. We are starting off with three products that we need your help to produce. These are:


The Play Pant - Unisex

We have made the best play pant in the world! Made out of a strong, long lasting polyamide/Supplex fabric, with a very ergonomic pattern construction that allows the boy/girl to play without restricting them. This style is perfect in almost all weather conditions. With the reinforced knees and bum, the kids can easily crawl around on the ground when playing without you worrying too much of them tearing the pants. A simple, clean style that is easy and comfortable to use.


See the video when our test pilot is testing the Play Pant:


The Polar Bear Longsleeve - Unisex

The Polar Bear LS tee is made in a slightly heavier stretchy organic cotton quality, cut in a regular fit, with a dropped back hem to cover the kids' back when squatting or playing on the ground. With flatlock seams throughout you don't have to worry for chafing. With the polar bear chest print we want to raise awareness about the endangered bears. To make you think about what's going on in the world instead of designing yet another pink cat print with a shiny tiara.

Polar bears live in the Arctic ice and feed on other animals that live in the area, such as seals, dead whales and walruses. Global warming causes the ice to melt and thus polar bear’s hunting grounds and living areas. The seals seek out other places and leave the polar bears hungry. Polar bears are in turn forced to swim mile long distances in search of a neighboring island or larger floes. The long distances mean that polar bears drown because they do not have the energy to swim more than a few miles at a time. When they are lacking food their low energy level holds them back even more. If we can’t stop the globing warming, we need to give the polar bears swimming aid, or 2/3 of the population will be extinct by 2050.


The Panda Tee - Unisex

The Panda Tee is made in a slightly heavier stretchy organic cotton quality, cut in a regular fit, with a dropped back hem to cover the kids' back when squatting or playing on the ground. With flatlock seams throughout you don't have to worry for chafing. With the panda chest print we want to raise awareness about the endangered pandas. To make you think about what's going on in the world instead of designing yet another hero print with stars.

Pandas are dying out mainly because of one main reason: habitat loss. Their main source of food is bamboo, which takes a long time to grow. This problem wasn't present when pandas were spread throughout the massive southeast of Asia, including China. Hence, when a forest of bamboo was being consumed by them, or a forest bloomed out, they could simply move to another bamboo forest, but as the forests have been cut down the pandas are finding food supply harder to find after a bloom out. Wild pandas have been reported to die because of starvation simply because they cannot reach the next bamboo forest quickly enough, or at all.


The Fit - Unisex

The Play Pant is designed in a slightly loose fit to givet the boy/girl freedom of movement when wearing the pant. From the knee down the leg is cut in a narrower shape to prevent extra fabric from getting in the way when running. The back rise is extra high and shaped to cover the back when the child is squatting or playing on the ground. The bum and knee areas are articulated which gives a general better fit and also enhanced freedom of movement when palying. The waist and leg cuffs have integrated elastic to secure that the pant stays on the body properly.

The Polar Bear Longsleeve has a normal fit, with raglan cut sleeves. The raglan construction makes it easier for the girl/boy to raise its arms and the longsleeve tee will stay in place, without exposing her/his midriff. The dropped back hem will cover the back. 

The Panda Tee has a normal fit, with a set in sleeve construction. A fantastic looking normal tee with a dropped back hem that covers the childs back when playing. 

All clothes are unisex. We are not putting the garments in a gender stereotypic tray. We are not telling you what color you should buy or which fit the clothes should have based on your child’s gender. Our clothes are for all children, girls and boys like to play as much. Our pieces will allow them to be themselves and to help them grow their own personalities.


Fabric and Finish Features

The Play Pants are made of polyamide/Supplex fabric that is very soft against the skin, durable and moisture wicking, has excellent abrasion resistance and strength. The cordura is extremely strong and durable and the supplex gives the fabric a cotton hand feel and look. A perfect combination of modern technology and traditional cotton appeal. The fabric has excellent breathability and dries in a fraction of time when compared to normal cotton fabric in equal thickness. This material is long lasting and very easily cleaned. Because of the water repellency treatment of the fabric the pant will stay dryer longer. The Play Pants have heavy duty thread throughout the whole garment for durability.

The Polar Bear Longsleeve and the Panda Tee are made of organic cotton material with 5% Elastane for better stability of the fabric and comfort. They are constructed with soft filament thread in the whole garment.


Direct Sales

Alice & Ted's playwear are exclusively sold through our website direct to you – without middle hands.

We are able to pass the savings on to you.
That is the reason why customers profit with increased savings over competing brands.

You profit qualitatively by the direct communication. We can afford to use better materials and higher quality production.

No one can answer your questions better than us. From the first idea to the final product, everything lies in our hands. Our knowledge pool is clearly much larger than a dealer/retailer could ever provide.

We communicate directly with you. We know what you expect from your kids' garments… they deserve the best. Our customers’ requests are not derived from statistic data – we listen to what you say and how you feel about the products you buy for your kids. From this relationship we make our decisions. We feel that this is the best way to develop the best playwear there is.

We all know how hard it is to shop with small children. Trying things on can really be difficult. With direct sales, you can try the clothing on at home, when they are up for it and in a good mood.

You can always shop at Alice & Ted. No matter what time it is or what country you are from you can get our garments.

Fantastic playwear with a superior price/performance-ratio directly from us.


Sizing Chart

All our styles come in sizes: 98, 104, 110, 116, 122 and 128. Below is our sizing chart and a guide to help you convert children's clothing sizes between geographical regions.

Here is how you measure.

Height

Measure from the top of the head down to the ground - ensuring the child is barefoot and has his or her heels together and feet flat on the floor. The height in cm = European size.

Chest

Take the tape under the arms and measure around the fullest part of the chest.

Waist

Place the tape measure around the natural waistline, taking care not to pull it too tightly.

Hips

Place the tape measure around the fullest part of the bottom.

Inside leg

Measure with shoes on, from the crotch area to approximately 5cm above the ground.


What Is Next?

We already have the designs ready, fantastic looking prototypes, have strong relationships with our suppliers, and we are ready to go. If we are successfully funded we will work really, really hard to make sure that you will get your products in the agreed timeframe. 

Watch the video below to see how our first Play Pant prototype was made:


Links


Other Ways You Can Help

Help us spread the word about our campaign. Use the buttons above to share it on facebook and blogs.

Thank you for your support and for checking us out!

We'd love to talk to you. Feel free to email us at hello@aliceted.se 

or call us at +46 8 559 25 444 about anything.


Challenges

We have tried to give ourselves plenty of time for fulfillment and if things go to plan then your rewards will be dispatched well within the timeframe we have laid out (under each reward on the right). We have worked really hard to put the logistics in place and because of our great relationships with our suppliers and manufacturers we feel very confident we will make you satisfied. We believe in transparency and communication and if a problem arises, we will keep you informed at every step, to make sure you receive your products as soon as possible.

We feel that this is the best way to develop the best playwear there is.
We all know how hard it is to shop with small children. Trying things on can really be difficult. With direct sales, you can try the clothing on at home, when they are up for it and in a good mood.
You can always shop at Alice & Ted. No matter what time it is or what country you are from you can get our garments.
Fantastic playwear with a superior price/performance-ratio directly from us.


Sizing Chart
All our styles come in sizes: 98, 104, 110, 116, 122 and 128. Below is our sizing chart and a guide to help you convert children's clothing sizes between geographical regions.



Here is how you measure.






Height
Measure from the top of the head down to the ground - ensuring the child is barefoot and has his or her heels together and feet flat on the floor. The height in cm = European size.
Chest
Take the tape under the arms and measure around the fullest part of the chest.
Waist
Place the tape measure around the natural waistline, taking care not to pull it too tightly.
Hips
Place the tape measure around the fullest part of the bottom.
Inside leg
Measure with shoes on, from the crotch area to approximately 5cm above the ground.

What Is Next?
We already have the designs ready, fantastic looking prototypes, have strong relationships with our suppliers, and we are ready to go. If we are successfully funded we will work really, really hard to make sure that you will get your products in the agreed timeframe. Watch the video below to see how our first Play Pant prototype was made:LinksOther Ways You Can HelpHelp us spread the word about our campaign. Use the buttons above to share it on facebook and blogs.Thank you for your support and for checking us out!We'd love to talk to you. Feel free to email us at hello@aliceted.se or call us at +46 8 559 25 444 about anything.ChallengesWe have tried to give ourselves plenty of time for fulfillment and if things go to plan then your rewards will be dispatched well within the timeframe we have laid out (under each reward on the right). We have worked really hard to put the logistics in place and because of our great relationships with our suppliers and manufacturers we feel very confident we will make you satisfied. We believe in transparency and communication and if a problem arises, we will keep you informed at every step, to make sure you receive your products as soon as possible.

story:
UPDATE --> GALLERY (PICTURES OF COLLECTION)

 

GERMAN:

Kurzbeschreibung

Chinoy wurde von zwei jungen, kreativen Jungs aus Zürich gegründet. Der spezielle Name setzt sich aus den Herkunftsländer China und Philippinen der zwei Designer zusammen. Beide sind zur Hälfte Schweizer. Das Logo mit den drei Tropfen stellen die drei Nationalitäten dar. Neben dem designen von Kleidern verschönern sie ab und zu auch Sneakers.

Dein Unterstützungsbeitrag soll uns helfen unsere Produktion der diesjährigen Summer Collection zu finanzieren und diese unter die Leute zu bringen damit wir auch in Stores Einzug erhalten. Damit können wir lokal den Durchbruch schaffen.

Oben findet ihr unsere Gallerie mit gewissen Produkten unserer letzen Kollektionen.

Was wir brauchen & Was Ihr bekommt

Um unsere Collection vollständig zu produzieren benötigen wir 2000$
Damit lassen wir unsere T-Shirts, Crewnecks, GymBags, Snapbacks, Basketballshorts, Leggins und Stickers in China Produzieren, zu uns Versenden, Verzollen und Vertreiben.

Unsere Collection wird in jeder Form als Limitierte Auflage erscheinen.

Tanktops
T-Shirts
Crewnecks
SnapBacks eventuell.
GymBags
Basketballshorts 
Leggins 
Stickers

Unsere Perks beziehen sich auf unsere Produkte sowie Dienstleistungen.
Erhalte durch einen Perk eines unserer Produkte Gratis. Oder Lass dir von uns einer deiner Schuhe einzigartig und von Hand verschönern.

Falls wir die 2000$ nicht erreichen fliest das Geld auch zu uns aber wir produzieren damit nur einen gewissen Teil unserer Collection was sehr schade um die anderen Produkte wäre die wir gerne für diese Collection produziert hätten. Natürlich erhaltet ihr von der kleineren Produktion etwas was dem Wert eurer Investition gerecht wird. Darüber informieren wir euch wenn es soweit kommt.

Die Auswirkung

Durch eure Investition in Chinoy Clothing und unserer Collection helf ihr mehr Vielfallt in unseren grauen Kleidungsalltag zu bringen. Dies erzeugen wir durch ausgefallene und kreative Designs. Sei es auf dem Shirt oder am Fuss.

Erhalte dadurch die Möglichkeit ein Teil von etwas einzigartigem zu werden.

Andere Wege, wie man helfen kann

Nicht jeder hat ein PayPal Account oder eine Kreditkarte aber auch die die dies Besitzen haben manchmal kein Geld um uns zu unterstützen. Das heisst aber noch lange nicht das ihr nichts für den Erfolg von Chinoy Clothing tun könnt.
Shared unser Indiegogo Projekt und vielleicht unterstützt ein anderer unser Projekt.

Teilt es der Welt mit auf Facebook, Twitter, Instagram etc.
Wir freuen uns über jede Unterstützung sei es Viral oder mit Geld alles hilft uns.

Danke euch

CHINOY CLOTHING


ENGLISH TRANSLATION:

Short Description

Chinoy was founded by two young creative guys from Zurich. The special name consists of the countries of origin China and Philippines together where the two designers come from. Both are half Swiss. The logo with the three drops represent the three nationalities. Addition to the design of apparell they also customize sneakers from time to time.

Your contribution will help us to get our production of this year's Summer Collection started, to fund and bring it to more people and maybe get the possibility to move in a first store with our stuff. So that we can locally make the breakthrough.

Above you will find our gallery of some of our older products from the last collections.

What we need & what you get

To fully produce our Collection, we need $ 2,000.
With this money we produce our t-shirts, Crewnecks, GymBags, Snapbacks, basketball shortsn leggins and stickers in China, us shipping, customs clearance and distribution.

Our collection will be released in any form as a Limited Edition.

Tanktops
T-Shirts
Crewnecks
SnapBacks maybe.
GymBags
Basketballshorts 
Leggins 
Stickers

Our perks relating to our products and services
Receive one of our products through a Perk for free. Or let us customize one of your shoes to get an unique and hand embellish Shoe.

If we do not reach the $ 2,000 we still got the money but we have to produce only a certain part of our collection which would be very sad about the other products that we would like to have produced for this collection. Of course you get some of the smaller production what is the equal value of your donation. Furthermore, we inform you if it comes to this point.

The effect

Through your investment in our Chinoy Clothing Collection you'll help to bring more diversity to our everyday cold clothes. This what we created will be with unusual and creative designs. If it's on the shirt or on foot.

Thereby you get the opportunity to be a part of something unique.

 

Other ways you can help

Not everyone has a PayPal account or a credit card but also the people with a account doesn't have money on they're PayPal or credit card to support us. That doesn't mean you can do nothing for the success of Chinoy Clothing.

Share our Indiegogo project and maybe another supports our project.

Share it with the world on Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, etc.
We are glad with any support, if it's viral or money. All the things will help us.

Thank you

CHINOY CLOTHING

story:
Short Summary

  • Nicole Bridger is an award winning ethical clothing company out of Vancouver that is committed to sustainable apparel and ethical manufacturing. 
  • We are launching the CORE Closet Collection to provide ethical, sustainable and stylish staples for women around the world.
  • It is our goal to change the way our clothing is made and how we buy clothing each season -  and you can help that come true.
  • The Core Closet Collection allows you to have the staples you need to last a long time and have been ethically made.

What We Need & What You Get

  • We are looking to raise $25,000 and every dollar raised will go to manufacturing the CORE Closet Collection in ethical factories.
  • You will receive beautiful, ethical, comfortable women's clothing staples for you to style however you like. 
  • If we don't reach our goal, we will still use these funds to help launch us into the next phase because we believe this concept is the foundation to more ethical closets globally.

The Impact

  • The textile industry is the second most polluting in our world today and the apparel industry relies heavily on forced labour. We can change that!
  • Sustainable means natural or recycled fibres and using Azo free dyes.
  • Ethical manufacturing means fair wages, good working conditions and no child or forced labour.
  • The CORE Closet Collection will be manufactured in a ethical and sustainable factory that we work extremely closely with.
  • We believe in buying less and buying better. We provide options for our clients that are values aligned. And we are committed to showing it's possible to have style while impacting positive change.

Risks & Challenges

  • Cashflow is one of the biggest challenges in the apparel industry.
  • We have been through many ups and downs in our time and know the meaning of resilience.

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Even if you can't contribute please help us by sharing this to a friend that you feel would be inspired by what we are up to!
  • Remember to use the Indiegogo share tools!

Short Summary

Nicole Bridger is an award winning ethical clothing company out of Vancouver that is committed to sustainable apparel and ethical manufacturing. 
We are launching the CORE Closet Collection to provide ethical, sustainable and stylish staples for women around the world.
It is our goal to change the way our clothing is made and how we buy clothing each season -  and you can help that come true.
The Core Closet Collection allows you to have the staples you need to last a long time and have been ethically made.


What We Need & What You Get

We are looking to raise $25,000 and every dollar raised will go to manufacturing the CORE Closet Collection in ethical factories.
You will receive beautiful, ethical, comfortable women's clothing staples for you to style however you like. 
If we don't reach our goal, we will still use these funds to help launch us into the next phase because we believe this concept is the foundation to more ethical closets globally.


The Impact

The textile industry is the second most polluting in our world today and the apparel industry relies heavily on forced labour. We can change that!
Sustainable means natural or recycled fibres and using Azo free dyes.
Ethical manufacturing means fair wages, good working conditions and no child or forced labour.
The CORE Closet Collection will be manufactured in a ethical and sustainable factory that we work extremely closely with.
We believe in buying less and buying better. We provide options for our clients that are values aligned. And we are committed to showing it's possible to have style while impacting positive change.


Risks & Challenges

Cashflow is one of the biggest challenges in the apparel industry.
We have been through many ups and downs in our time and know the meaning of resilience.


Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can't contribute please help us by sharing this to a friend that you feel would be inspired by what we are up to!
Remember to use the Indiegogo share tools!

story:
Jibbon - a minimalist, anti-scratch key organiser made from Italian leather and marine-grade stainless steel. It’s time to upgrade your everyday carry.

The patent-pending locking mechanism allows for easy micro-adjustment. No tools or coins are required to change the keys. 

By continually testing with users during the prototyping phase we developed a clear understanding of what customers wanted. We researched existing solutions and summarised below how effectively these met user needs.

Jibbon Features:

  • No tool / coin required
  • Holds up to 9 keys
  • Won't scratch  your phone
  • No loose parts during assembly
  • Durable edges
  • Won't loosen from use
  • 3 Year Warranty
  • D-ring Included
  • Assembly Time (3 keys)
  • Early Bird Price $31 (USD)

 

We wanted to put an end to the noisy, sharp key bundle. Most people carrying keys find it uncomfortable in their pockets. It scratches their phone and wears holes.

Unlike other key organisers, Jibbon doesn't include any loose wave washers, springs or spacers.

High quality, corrosion resistant stainless steel is used for all metal parts. We have strength tested each element to meet the needs of the user. Every part of the design has been refined to eliminate unnecessary parts, ensuring reliability.

Each key organiser includes an extension, allowing you to fit between 3 to 9 keys.  

Add in the multi-tool when travelling -  (2.3mm Thick).

Include the 32GB USB when you need files on the go (4.6mm Thick).

Monogramming - up to 3 uppercase characters. 

Removable D-ring with a matte PVD finish.

We use our own range of distinctive leathers, sourced directly from tanneries in Italy. The leather is top grain, dyed by skilled artisans. Traditional processes are used to enhance the rich colour and soft texture.

Available in 4 distinct colours, choose the perfect match for you, your loved one or friends.

Can’t stand having your keys and phone in the same pocket? Your phone screen will love the genuine Italian leather covering the metal parts. Your phone and other belongings will stay protected.

We listened to customers to understand the pain points of current key organiser solutions. From there, we created new concepts and continually improved on them until we found the best solution. We didn’t settle on the final design until we had tested, used and shared our prototypes with friends and family. 

 We  3D printed over 500 prototyped parts to get the perfect design.

Each element of the Jibbon Key organiser is designed by us. There are no “off the shelf” parts.

We have begun production molds for the metal parts (shown below).

Want to add a Jibbon Multi-Tool or USB or another accessory? Simply choose at the pledge level, or during the backer survey once you have pledged.

story:
Nalu Floats was created by a couple of friends who spend a lot of their time on and around the water, giving them an appreciation for what a quality polarized lens can offer. Understanding that being around water comes with the always the present risk of losing their sunglasses, they both chose separate ways of dealing with this. One of them elected to wear cheap, disposable shades at the cost of his vision and the other chose to wear quality shades at the cost of his wallet whenever a pair was lost to the water.  

Torn between these options, the two set out on a mission to solve their dilemma. How could they have cool shades with quality polarized lenses for a reasonable price, that - most importantly - could not be lost on the water? The answer was to make them float! And Nalu Floats was born...

We believe there is no need for sunglasses to be outrageously expensive nor for reasonably priced sunglasses to be excluded from using premium materials and features. In the case of Nalu sunglasses, we believe they should surpass their more expensive counterparts in every way. 

"Nalu sunglasses are built to wear with you".

Nalu Sunglasses are:  

  • Floating 
  • Indestructible 
  • 100% UV Polarized
  • Scratch Resistant Lenses

Unsinkable: Nalu frames are moulded using a TR90 thermoplastic composite with NaluTek™ aircell technology giving them a sturdy yet lightweight feel. NaluTek™ aircells enable floatation without the need for unsightly additions, such as foam inserts. This allows your Nalu to be what they should be - good looking sunglasses, that's also float.

Indestructible: Seeing is believing - Nalus are built to be worn... Hard! NaluTek™ frames come as close as is possible to completely indestructible. Adjustable and formfitting NaluTek™ frames are able to withstand up to 180° of flex for those unforeseen however inevitable moments in your active lifestyle.

 

Bammo Collection

Comfortable and modern, yet ready for watersport action: the Bammo collection is constructed using a NaluTek™ floating frame featuring a subtle semi-translucent black camouflage design.

  

Smokies Collection 

Comfortable and modern, yet ready for watersport action: the Smokies collection is constructed using a NaluTek™ floating frame featuring a semi-translucent black design. 

DESCRIPTION 

  • Frame size and style ideal for a universal head fit. 
  • Floating thermoplastic NaluTek™ frame. 
  • Scratch-resistant polycarbonate polarized lenses. 
  • Mirror lens with 13.5% visible light transmission. (15% grey)

TECH SPECS 

  • Ideal for Sport / casual 
  • Lens material Polarized polycarbonate 
  • Frame material Nalutek™ TR90 thermoplastic 
  • Lens performance - Fixed Tint / Scratch resistant / Polarized 
  • Lens width 60mm 
  • Nose bride width 16mm 
  • Arm length 150mm 
  • Lens height 46mm 
  • 100% UVB protected 
  • 100% UVA protected
