story:
3rd STRETCH GOAL: $7,500

We're doing an amazing job! Let's keep this going!

The more funds we raise, the more we produce, and the more tees we give to Haiti.

--------------------------------------

2nd STRETCH GOAL: $5000

Reached on 16th day of campaign!

--------------------------------------

1st STRETCH GOAL: $3600

Reached on 10th day of campaign!

--------------------------------------

INITIAL GOAL: $2000

Reached on 5th day of campaign! 

--------------------------------------
 
Hi everyone!
 
In June, I will be traveling to Haiti on a service trip with Clothes4Souls, a global charity organization, to distribute clothing at the Clothes4Souls Community Center in Port-au-Prince.
 
To ensure the distribution of new and well-constructed clothing, I have designed a quality basic tee that I hope to bulk produce in Los Angeles and distribute to people in need while in Haiti.
 
Your contribution will directly fund the cost of production. The goal is to hit the minimum order quantity, but the more we raise, the more we will produce, and the more tees we will give to Haiti.
 
Let’s get back to basics, and see how much change we can make.
 
Thank you! 
 
Jeff 
 

About Clothes4Souls

Clothes4Souls, a subsidiary of Soles4Souls, is a global clothing charity organization that facilitates donations to poor areas in need in 125 countries. They also coordinate service trips to allow volunteers to aid in distribution and experience first-hand the positive impact of giving.
 
Visit: www.clothes4souls.org
Volunteer: www.clothes4souls.org/get_involved
Give Used Clothes: www.clothes4souls.org/about/locations
 
 
 
 

About the Tee

My quality basic tee will be manufacturerd in Los Angeles with 100% premium combed cotton. It features a thin and lightweight yarn, a bleached-white color, a left-chest pocket, and a modern fit. The tee is pre-shunk and silicon-washed for a lived-in handfeel, and is available in sizes S, M, L, and XL. In the photo below, I am wearing a size Medium.
 
 

About the Perks

Your contributions will make this project possible, and I have created some great perks to show my appreciation for your support! (To contribute, choose an option on the right side of this webpage.) 
 
To thank you for fully covering the costs of sending tees to Haiti: 
 
If you contribute $10, you will receive a personal postcard from me with a photo and note from Haiti.
 
If you contribute $20, along with a postcard, you will receive 1 quality basic tee of your own.
 
If you contribute $40 or more, along with a postcard, you will receive 2 quality tees of your own.
 
If you contribute $100 or more, along with receiving 2 quality basic tees of your own, you will also receive a video postcard from Haiti.
 
**Please note that I will send you a personal email after you've contributed to ask for your shirt size, and that you have the option to donate to Haiti the tees that would otherwise be sent directly to you.
 

About Me

After graduating from Colgate University, I moved to Columbus, OH, where I work as a merchant for a fashion-retail company. I am also a student at Cotton University, the Columbus College of Art and Design, and the Columbus Cultural Arts Center, where I take adult classes in cotton production, yarn manufacturing, pattern-making, figure drawing, and digital art. I have a love for minimal and practical design, a passion for the creative arts, and a strong desire to pay it forward.

I have a love for minimal and practical design, a passion for the creative arts, and a strong desire to pay it forward.

story:
FOR PEACE AND ALL LIFE!

We at Life Matters Journal have a goal and a mission: to make aggressive violence of all kinds unthinkable. We want to make it history. The only way that we can do this is to change hearts and minds to understand that all human life is worth protecting.

So, we agreed that one of the best ways to spread the message for peace and all life is through clothing -- it brings the message wherever you go, and invites conversation. We hope that in uniting around our project, people feel the strength of community and support for our cause and do not get discouraged against the apathy and inconsistency of our world.

CHOOSE A DIFFERENT SIDE.

By creating this clothing line, not only do we engender community within our movement and support the further education and discourse so necessary to changing hearts and minds, we offer a way to begin discussions, to bring these issues to the forefront of society.

Many of us are tired of the dual-party politics in the United States that offers only halfway solutions to violence; instead of choosing which lives are valuable, we want to offer a different way. Valuing all human life: opposing capital punishment, abortion, unjust war, embryonic stem cell research, torture, abuse, human trafficking, and all other forms of aggressive violent action.

By wearing these shirts, individuals young and old can start that conversation that will plant that seed. Maybe we can work to hold our politicians accountable and change the discourse in this country to one that values peace and life.

BE CONSISTENT.

The Life Matters Clothing Initiative is a design and production project to bring these messages to the streets in our every-day wear. Our team has been hard at work to produce designs worthy of wear and conversation. We've produced many designs and they've gone to a vote on our Facebook page. 

Our printing will all be done through a local-to-Pittsburgh eco-friendly print shop who we trust to be good to our cause and to the planet. Though we have put all of our own resources into the design process, we need your help, as a global community, to print these shirts and spread our message. 


::THE PRODUCTS::


Be Consistent shirt 

Be Consistent FRONT
Be Consistent BACK

For Peace and All Life shirt

For Peace and All Life FRONT
For Peace and All Life BACK (in progress, font may change)

Choose Another Side shirt

Choose Different FRONT
Choose Different BACK

The deadline & our goal...

We're hoping to reach our goal by December 5, and have the shirts printed by  the release date for the next issue of Life Matters Journal (December 30). All shirts/products would be shipped out by January 2013 if we meet our goal. 

NOTE: ALL DONATIONS INCLUDE SHIPPING COSTS. Think of it as "the shirts cost $15, shipping is $5." :)

Our goal is $1350, which will fund the creation of 300 shirts (100 of each of 3  designs) for you to share with your community and your world. 

Once the deadline has passed - if we reach the goal - we will post updates on our Facebook page and our blog! Stay tuned!

www.lifemattersjournal.org
https://www.facebook.com/LifeMattersJournal

story:
Short Summary

My name is Maryam Entezami. I was born in Iran, in 1980 my family and I left Iran for Turkey. Since 1990 I live in Netherlands. In 1997 I graduated as a fashion designer. During my study I took a “ History of Costumes” Course. To my surprise there was little to no information available on Ancient Persian costumes.  At first I was really disappointed but it also triggered my ambition. It became my graduation project and I continued my research when I started as an independent fashion designer up till today.

My investigation covers the Persian Women Costume from the Elam (2700 – 538 B.C.) dynasty to date including the folkloric costumes. Over the years I have been collecting information, translating historic images into concrete designs.

My ultimate goal is to publish a book that shows the richness in Ancient Persian Costume tradition from the ancient Iranian History since Elamites Dynasty (2700-538 B.C.) to Pahlavi Dynasty (1925-1979) illustrated with pictures of my fashion designs as a direct translation. 

What We Need & What You Get

I need to raise $28,000. This will cover the cost to complete my collection and to make it visible through a website. I want to capture the images both in photography & film to use for an exposure. Finally I want to use all this to turn the content into a Fashion show/ exposition. I want to inform people about the fashion of one of the oldest civilizations in the world.

$ 10     Supporter

$ 100   A concise book of my research & work

$ 500   Book & a shawl with Persian motive

$ 1000  A outfit from Achaemenid  Empire, The Achaemenid Empire came to be known as the greatest Persian Empire. The empire was established by Cyrus the Great and saw the rise of some of the greatest kings of ancient history.

The Impact

My collection up till now contains over approximately 30 costumes from the Elam period to Pahlavi Dynasty. My first successful exhibition was "Iranian Folkloric Garments", presented in 1997 in the Museum of Anthropology in Leiden, the Netherlands. In addition to several successful exhibitions in the Netherlands, I have shown my collection in Belgium, Germany, Switzerland, and England (Manoto TV).  

My ultimate goal is to share my costumes, knowledge & insights to a bigger audience to make the richness of our Persian culture more tangible and visible. I hope you are willing to support me in this goal and to make it our joined effort.

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you are not able to help me in financial means, you would really help me by getting the word out. I appreciate your support in all forms:  telling your friends about us through Facebook, website, email, twitter etc. Please use my  Facebook page http://www.facebook.com/persiancostume,  Website www.maryentez.com & INDIEGOGO  to spread the word!

Hello Fans of Yarnosphere!

>>>SOMEBODY was anonymous *AND* donated WITHOUT selecting a perk. All our attempts to contact you have failed. Please contact amy at yarnosphere dot com ASAP!

We have emailed everyone who didn't pick up their tote bags and goody bags to confirm your shipping address. The email went to your PayPal email address. As soon as the last two addresses come in, we will ship the bags.

And for those of you who picked up your bags this weekend, thanks for making Yarnosphere a success :)

story:
THANK YOU to everyone who contributed.  Enjoy your perks!


Now that our Indiegogo campaign is over, you can order Puzzle Apparel garments at http://www.puzzleapparel.com

VIEW OUR ARTIST GALLERY

When you contribute to our Indiegogo campaign today, you will only need to choose your style(s) by clicking on your desired perk at the top right side of the page.  Once the campaign is over and we have all our orders together, you'll go through the process of selecting size, color, and handmade fabric to design your item.


PRESS: 

"Puzzle Apparel brings together two of my favorite ways of making clothes: customization and artisanship.  This genius combination works... pretty simply - enough so we wonder why we didn't think of it first.  It's the new DIY: design-it-yourself."

-Eco Chick

For all perks, shipping within the US is free.  International shipping rates will be added to your total.

Check out our behind the scenes video showing how we designed and documented our first collection...



Other Ways You Can Help: Make Noise!

Join our Puzzle Apparel family of stylish, social conscious visionaries.

If you can't contribute financially (or even if you can), it will make such a difference if each one of you makes some noise about our Indiegogo campaign. 

Every time you tell someone what Puzzle Apparel is doing, you help us grow.  When we grow we can buy more handmade work by American artists, create more beautiful products, and build a sustainable business.

Don't forget to use the Indiegogo sharing tools below!

SEE THE REST OF OUR ARTISTS' WORK IN OUR ARTIST GALLERY

FREQUENTLY ASKED QUESTIONS:
1. When do I design my Puzzle Apparel clothes?  At the end of the campaign we'll contact you to confirm your details.  Then we'll place an order for handmade fabric with our artist partners.  After a month, when the handmade fabric is complete, we will send you a link to a page where you can design your items.

2. When will I get my Puzzle Apparel?  Normally production will require two weeks for sewing.  However, since this is our first production run, we will need:
  • a few days after our campaign to confirm your details
  • 1 month for our artist partners to hand-create accent fabrics
  • a few days for you to design your orders from the handmade fabrics
  • 5 weeks for our first production run at our sewing facility (their requirement).  
Total it up to about 10 weeks to produce our first collection.  Add in shipping time and you should get your garments by mid March.

3. Can I reserve a specific handmade fabric shown on this page?  The handmade materials shown on this page are only for demonstration purposes, to exhibit the type of work our artist partners create.  After our Indiegogo campaign is over, our artist partners will create the handmade materials you'll get to actually choose from when you design your Puzzle Apparel.  There will be a lot of choices, so don't worry!  And if you simply cannot decide on a design, you can redeem your perk at a later date.

4. How do I wash my Puzzle Apparel?  Puzzle Apparel washing instructions depend on which handmade fabric you select.  Most garments are hand washable or dry clean.

story:
What is it?

Radium is a project creating a suite of apps for mobile phones that allow you to make phone calls, send texts and video chat with your friends while protecting yourself from spying or eavesdropping with encryption. 

Why are you creating it?

The right of all people to protect intimate conversations with cryptography is too important to leave in the hands of a small collection of companies, many of whom are doing a very bad job.
 
The focus of Radium is to integrate features similar to the ones found in familiar applications, such as Whatsapp or Skype, while preserving privacy and openness, and keeping things inexpensive or free.

I (Jeff Griffin) have been stirred to action after over a year of planning software in this vein, after watching several companies and organizations come out to capitalize on mass hysteria with poor ideas claiming to use "encryption."

Many, many other groups have built secure apps of varying stripes that provide basic functionality such as text messaging and calling, but I want to see apps that have a great user interface, are loaded with normal features and are built with security in mind from the start; the goal of Radium consists less of creating "yet another encryption app", and is more about competing with dominant services with the hope of setting a standard for security.

Which platforms is Radium targeting?

Currently, Radium is slated to release apps on Android.

What are the features of Radium's apps?

  • Strong cryptography out of the box. There are no switches to flip or settings to mess with. Just fire up an app and enjoy your privacy!
  • Competent, professional design. Radium is being designed, created and tested by a professional with a background in theoretical mathematics and computer engineering. We use reliable implementations of trusted algorithms, and our protocol design is based off of existing work such as OTR and ZRTP.
  • The same features you're used to, made secure. We aim to integrate popular features from other applications so that "being safe" doesn't mean "being constrained." Share your geographic location or embed pictures while sending text messages, or stream your recorded videos live to your friends while chatting!
  • Use your own network. If you don't want to use our network - no problem. Radium can be configured to use your company's private infrastructure. Need an ad-hoc communications network on short notice with unbreakable encryption? Radium can handle that.†
  • No monthly subscription fee. Simply pay upfront in the online store for the application, or download one of our open-source distributions and begin encrypting your communication without a hassle.
  • Transparent. Radium will have a publicly-available protocol whitepaper, as well as source code, in the interest of user security. In the event that the project is sabotaged with a backdoor, anyone in the community can fork the code
  • Easy sharing. Radium allows you to create and read QR codes in order to securely add people to your contacts list. Put one on your business card or webpage, just like a phone number.
  • Want to see more? Check out a brief technical overview: [img] [pdf].

†Performance is not guaranteed when Radium is configured to use a user-designated network.

So, why are you on Indiegogo?

Indiegogo helps fund the development cycle, and to purchase server infrastructure. It also has the secondary benefit of helping to gauge how much interest exists in the product.

Are smartphones really a secure platform?

On their own - no. It is quite clear that attempts are made to weaken electronic devices, such as computer processors and cellphones, in order to thwart cryptography.

However, Radium is a step forward in securing network-level communications. Hopefully in time, we will have trusted devices that are as popular as the iPhone or Android smartphones.

When will it be ready?

There are no specific dates available, in order to avoid disappointment. Reward estimates involving the completion of the app(s) should be considered a "rough guideline" at best.

Public announcements will be made at important points in the development process only.

Where can I get more information?

Stay tuned to the official Twitter feed here.
story_txt:
What is it?Radium is a project creating a suite of apps for mobile phones 
that allow you to make phone calls, send texts and video chat with your 
friends while protecting yourself from spying or eavesdropping with 
encryption. Why are you creating it?The right of 
all people to protect intimate conversations with cryptography is too 
important to leave in the hands of a small collection of companies, many
 of whom are doing a very bad job.  The focus of Radium is to integrate features similar to the ones found in familiar applications, such as Whatsapp or Skype, while preserving privacy and openness, and keeping things inexpensive or free.I (Jeff Griffin) have been stirred to action after over a year of planning software in this vein, after watching several companies and organizations come out to capitalize on mass hysteria with poor ideas claiming to use "encryption." Many, many other groups have built secure apps of varying stripes that provide basic functionality such as text messaging and calling, but I want to see apps that have a great user interface, are loaded with normal features and are built with security in mind from the start; the goal of Radium consists less of creating "yet another encryption app", and is more about competing with dominant services with the hope of setting a standard for security.Which platforms is Radium targeting?Currently, Radium is slated to release apps on Android.What are the features of Radium's apps?

Strong cryptography out of the box. There are no switches to flip or settings to mess with. Just fire up an app and enjoy your privacy!

Competent, professional design. Radium is being designed, created
 and tested by a professional with a background in theoretical 
mathematics and computer engineering. We use reliable implementations of trusted algorithms, and our protocol design is based off of existing work such as OTR and ZRTP.


The same features you're used to, made secure. We aim to 
integrate popular features from other applications so that "being safe" doesn't mean "being 
constrained." Share your geographic location or embed pictures while sending text messages, or stream your recorded videos live to your friends while chatting!


Use your own network. If you don't want to use our network - no 
problem. Radium can be configured to use your company's private 
infrastructure. Need an ad-hoc communications network on short notice 
with unbreakable encryption? Radium can handle that.†


No monthly subscription fee. Simply pay upfront in the online 
store for the application, or download one of our open-source 
distributions and begin encrypting your communication without a hassle.

Transparent. Radium will have a publicly-available protocol whitepaper, as well as source code, in the interest of user security. In the event that the project is sabotaged with a backdoor, anyone in the community can fork the code


Easy sharing. Radium allows you to create and read QR codes in 
order to securely add people to your contacts list. Put one on your 
business card or webpage, just like a phone number.

Want to see more? Check out a brief technical overview: [img] [pdf].

†Performance is not guaranteed when Radium is configured to use a user-designated network.

So, why are you on Indiegogo?Indiegogo helps 
fund the development cycle, and to purchase server infrastructure. It 
also has the secondary benefit of helping to gauge how much interest 
exists in the product.Are smartphones really a secure platform?On
 their own - no. It is quite clear that attempts are made to weaken 
electronic devices, such as computer processors and cellphones, in order
 to thwart cryptography.However, Radium is a step forward in 
securing network-level communications. Hopefully in time, we will have 
trusted devices that are as popular as the iPhone or Android 
smartphones.When will it be ready?There are no 
specific dates available, in order to avoid disappointment. Reward 
estimates involving the completion of the app(s) should be considered a "rough guideline" at best.Public announcements will be made at important points in the development process only.Where can I get more information?Stay tuned to the official Twitter feed here.

story:
Help SWINGURU to add a new dimension to the game!

Backing our project by supporting this initiative is more than just giving us money. It is supporting our dream to create and keep improving an easy-to-use, intuitive and interactive sports movement analysis software enabling an engaging training & self learning experience yet comprehensive and affordable. Golf has been selected as the first sport. Baseball will be next. 

Visit us www.swinguru.com

                                                      

Summary

Guru Training Systems is an innovative software company that specializes in digital teaching and learning sports solutions through state of the art 2D & 3D sports movement analysis technology.

Guru has successfully designed and developed two revolutionary products: 

Swinguru Pro and My Swinguru. With Swinguru, we meet teachers’ and amateurs’ needs to have a professional but mainly affordable training system that combines full body 2D & 3D movement analysis with simple, intuitive, and interactive sports learning experience.

It is now time for Guru to take Swinguru to the next level. In order to reach our goals we need your support.

Your money will be used to develop 3 specific projects:

  1. Bring to life Swinguru Pro 3.0, our next generation sport movement analyser software.

  2. Migrate our products towards multiple platforms (including Mac OS, Xbox, Set Top Box, iOS) and their respective customer segments  

  3. Produce Swinguru Box, a portable and easy to setup device to run our interactive Swinguru applications


                                                      

Swinguru Pro is THE FIRST wireless and markerless 2D & 3D golf swing analyzer and training system for teaching professionals who want to boost their lessons by embracing new technologies. It combines video and real-time 3D full body tracking and visualization with simple and intuitive biofeedback. It is the most comprehensive, cost effective solution in the marketplace that will add a new dimension to your business.


Key Features

AUTOMATIC SWING CAPTURE

Let your students swing facing the camera and it will be automatically recorded in 3 dimensions without having to operate the system.

    AUTOMATED VISUAL HELPERS

    Visual helpers are automatically drawn on screen, allowing you to focus on your student not on your computer. The usual manual drawing tools are also available.

      WIRELESS AND MARKERLESS

      No markers or bulky equipment needed to be detected or captured allowing users to practice as they play and whenever they’re ready.

        MULTIPLE VIEWS

        From a single swing capture our cameras allow 6 different views. It provides video and 2D & 3D views in synchronized viewports or side-by-side. 3D views available: face on, down the line, bird’s-eye (top), virtual balance plate.

          KEY POSITION LEARNING

          Record up to 7 ideal student’s 2D & 3D golf swing positions, then let him train by matching his ideal positions during progressive stages with live audio and visual feedback.


            What you need to use Swinguru:

            More details can be found at www.swinguru.com/how-it-works

            Instructors will use Swinguru to 

             Differentiate Themselves

             Improve Profitability

             Optimize Their Lessons

             Allow Natural Interaction

             Be Mobile

             Teach All Year Round


            Players will use Swinguru to

            Improve Training And Technique

            Focus Only On Swing

            Your Preferred Teacher Always Available

            Training Is Fun And Interactive

            Save Time And Money

            Share With Your Friends


            Swinguru vs other products on the market:


            Testimonials:





            Swinguru Box preview:


            Visit us www.swinguru.com

story:
Gray Matters (GraM)

We want to sell creative products in order to raise money for Alzheimer's research. Sure, we could just donate the money from this campaign directly, but if we invest it in tools to get our company off the ground, we can create a sustainable initiative that benefits everyone involved. Think social entrepreneurship in its simplest form.

  • We're a group of cousins who are watching our Grandma ("Gram"), along with over 5 million other Americans, develop and deal with Alzheimer's Disease. The science exists to stop this life-halting disease, but researchers need the capital to finance an actual cure because that stuff up in your head MATTERS! That's where we step in.
  • We have original products, from t-shirts to beanies (all ethically made in the U.S.) that you'll love anyways, but won't be able to resist when you find out that 25% of all of Gray Matters' profits will be directly donated toward research firms that are working toward an Alzheimer's cure, or support programs for those living with the disease.
  • By contributing to our campaign, you will one day be able to say you helped find the cure for Alzheimer's; a gift you will give to your own family and friends, as well as future generations.

What We Need & What You Get

It's simple: the funding we need will be almost entirely for obtaining and printing our original designs on our first products. Remaining funds will be used to create and promote our website.

  • You'll get perks for donating, such as being on our Founding Donors list on our website, or your choice of one of our very first products, free! See the "perks" list for more info! 
  • Besides some tangible goods, you can feel better about your wardrobe when you invest in the minds of the future.
  • If we don't reach our entire goal, we will scale down our plans for variety of merchandise until we have procured the capital to expand our products. No matter how much we raise, it will be put to good use!
  • If you'd like to see some of our potential designs, leave us a comment!

The Impact

Every 67 seconds, someone in the United States develops Alzheimer's. A cure could save over 500,000 lives a year. Gray Matters wants to end those crushing statistics once and for all. Using the same highly effective and sustainable business plans that other social enterprises employ, we hope to turn into a brand that can do some serious damage to this serious disease.


We're not asking you to only trust the science though - we're asking you to share a little love. Research shows that stimulation (anything from a hug to a nice chat) can help slow down the progression of Alzheimer's.  The goal of Gray Matters  is to start the buzz of how to help those with Alzheimer's!


Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't give now, don't worry about it. We will always love you! If you feel like Gray Matters is destined for something great, spread the word! Let your friends know about this campaign, and stay tuned for the launch of our website and social media pages! 

If that's not even your cup of tea, just think about how else you can support those in your community with Alzheimer's. Remember, a little love can go a long way!

TO CONTACT US: email graymatters05@gmail.com or leave a comment!

story:
Hi beautiful people! We are starting our own eco friendly world altering business together, and would like your help!

I, Cleo, am a budding herbalist, having graduated from Rosemary Gladstar's Herbal Apprenticeship, taken an Herb 101 course from Clayton College of Natural Health, taken Brigitte Mars class on Herbalism at Naropa University, and am currently taking the EastWest Planetary Herbology professional herbalist course with Micheal Tierra's EastWest Herbal School.   I grew up in nature and have always felt deeply connected with the natural world and nature spirits.  I feel it is time to start selling my herbal creations, such as tinctures, salves, beauty products, flower essences, aromatic mists, lip balms, massage oils, lotions, bath products, and liniments.

 I, Chad, have always been in touch with the animal spirits and natural world.  I am starting to make medicine bags out of recycled leather and found animal bones. I am also starting to make wooden hand carved earrings and plugs, amongst many other things that my mind can dream up.  I lived with a shaman who taught me how to make medicine bags and a native american family who taught me about wood carving. 

In our process of starting our businesses, we realize we both need a lot more materials to make it successful. That is where we need help!

We would like to offer our gratitude for your support in our fledgling business.

Expenses:

- Wood Carving- Wood cutting/carving tools, wood, jewelry accessories (gemstones, earwires, etc.), tables ---COST: $2000

- Medicine Bags- Recycled Leather, beads, consciously procured animal bones, sewing materials---COST: $1000

- Herbal Products- Oils, alcohol, containers (tincture bottles, salve, lip balm containers, mist bottles, etc), organic herbs, seeds for growing our own herbs, labels, packaging, strainers, cheesecloth, double boiler, funnels, and more ---COST: $2000

- Business Insurance ---COST: $40 per mnth xs 12+ $480 per year

- Marketing: $2000

- Farmers Market Fees: $2000

story:
Our Story

My name is Marilyn and I love accessories.  I asked myself what could I do, in my own small way, to help people?  To some, a handbag is just something to carry your things in.  To others, a bag is a fabulous fashion statement.  However, one bag can make a difference!  I want to donate thousands of handbags, backpacks, duffle bags, tote bags, clutches, and toiletries to organizations that collect accessories and other items to help girls/women/children. 

Initially, we started saving a percentage of our sales and found an organization that collects backpacks, duffle bags, and toiletries for foster children.  We purchased bags, toothpaste, deodorant, toothbrushes, brushes, combs and other toiletries and shipped the items to them and felt compelled to do more....to find more organizations to help and to help this organization again. 

 

The Impact

Imagine you're a child, with only a trash bag to carry your items from place to place. We want to donate backpacks, duffle bags, tote bags, school supplies and toiletries to organizations that collect items for foster children.  With your contribution, we can brighten a childs day.

Imagine you're in a shelter, without even the basic necessities. We want to donate deodorant, toothbrushes, toothpaste, lotions, combs, brushes, other necessary toiletries, tote bags and duffle bags to organizations that collect these items for shelters.  With your contribution, we can provide items to the shelters that need them.

Imagine you were out of the job market for a length of time.  You need to go on interviews, but do not have anything appropiate to wear.  You turn to your local organization that collects suits/career wear to get you started in the right direction.  We want to donate clutches and handbags to these organizations that promote the career advancement of women.  With your contribution, we can help women go into their interviews with confidence.

Imagine you're a senior in high school.  All of your friends are talking about the dress, shoes, and bag they're going to get for prom.  Your family cannot afford to buy a dress....you are crestfallen!  On the radio, you hear about a local organization that has collected and is giving away prom dresses.  The day is saved!  We want to donate clutches and handbags to these organizations that do such a great service for these young ladies.  I remember how excited my daughter was.... shopping for prom... and how much it meant to her to look her best.  With your contribution, we can help other girls have a beautiful prom.

 

 What We Need & What You Get

 

We will purchase backpacks, duffle bags, tote bags, handbags, cosmetic bags, lotion, deodorant, combs, brushes, toothbrushes, toothpaste, other toiletries, and school supplies to donate. 

Please help us by sharing this information with friends via email, facebook, twitter or any other social medium.

With your contribution, we can continue to donate bags and other items in years to come and continue to make a difference, one bag at a time.

story:
Our Story

See a Scarlet Robin piece of jewelry, and you'll want to touch it.  Hold it, and you'll want to put it on.  Wear it and, as we hear from hundreds of customers, it will become your daily style signature.

Right now, well over 90% of the 5K+ orders we've crafted have been placed online, by people who couldn't touch or try on before buying.  We come to you for help in getting our silver, gold and copper designs onto the counters of hundreds of boutiques around the world, so that a great many more people can experience the indulgence that is wearing a luxurious, handmade, Scarlet Robin treasure.

How do we take our business from e-commerce to a local shop or boutique near you?  Because it’s impossible for us to visit each and every boutique across the country, we need to be at an event where hundreds of shop owners have gathered.  To do this, we need to be in New York the first week of August for the event where shop owners will come find all the cool merchandise to fill their shelves for the holidays.  It’s like one big shopping spree for boutique owners.

We were chosen to be a part of this event in New York, and we must go!  But its shockingly expensive.  Every bit of your support you share means the world to us.  Every friend you forward our video to and share our story with is incredibly helpful.  You will most definitely be rewarded in all sorts of clever ways—because that’s what we do

 

Your Contribution

Ask any Scarlet Robin customer and they will tell you we have impeccable customer service, hands down.  They will also tell you we provide prompt response to inquiries, incredibly friendly service, and satisfaction in being well taken care of.  You will most certainly not be an exception when it comes time for us to reward you for your financial contribution.

To make your experience a bit more interesting, we thought you would like to see specific items that your contribution will make possible.

If you donate $600, this amount will cover our transportations costs (a plane ticket for Jillian, and gas to/from New York for Jenifer).

Interested in donating $1,500?  Cool!  You just paid for our hotel and lodging expenses for the week.

That $800 burning a hole in your pocket pays for our Fall 2012 Catalog costs.  Sweet!

We will graciously free you from the burden of hiding that $4,000 under your mattress and pay the booth fees for this glorious event. 

Yes, we enjoy having a little fun now and again, but we are incredibly grateful for your donation.  We look forward to the opportunity to personally thank each of you with your very own Scarlet Robin treasure.

For your convenience, we have listed the individual Perks with links to our website below.  We thought you would like to see the special items we picked out for you.

Pledge $5.00 or more - A Scarlet Robin thank you card featuring one of our designs.

Pledge $25.00 or more - You will receive our adorable Bitty Heart necklace on a silicone cord.  Shipped with a Scarlet Robin thank you card featuring one of our designs.

Pledge $50.00 or more - You will receive one of our most popular pieces - a personalized silicone bracelet with a name or word of your choice (up to 8 characters/spaces) hand-stamped on a ½” sterling silver disc accompanied by a birthstone charm.  Shipped with a Scarlet Robin thank you card featuring one of our designs.

Pledge $75.00 or more - Your choice of a 3/8" Silver Micro Monogram on a sterling silver chain or two (2) personalized silicone bracelets with a name or word of your choice (up to 8 characters/spaces) hand-stamped on a ½” sterling silver disc accompanied by a birthstone charm.  Both shipped with a Scarlet Robin thank you card featuring one of our designs.

Pledge $100.00 or more - You may choose from two of our most popular earrings styles; Large Pearl Frames in gold or Stone Frame Earrings.  Shipped with a Scarlet Robin thank you card featuring one of our designs.

Pledge $125.00 or more - One Silver Disc Monogram Necklace with your initial hanging on a sterling silver chain with a birthstone charm.  Shipped with a Scarlet Robin thank you card featuring one of our designs.

Pledge $500.00 or more - Your choice of a Monogram Cutout or Fleur de Lis in gold or silver.  Shipped with a Scarlet Robin thank you card featuring one of our designs.

Pledge $1,250.00 or more - Be a part of the design process and work with our studio to design a custom piece that will be named for you and included in our 2013 Spring/Summer Collection.  Shipped with a Scarlet Robin thank you card featuring one of our designs.

Pledge $2,500.00 or more - Five (5) $100 Scarlet Robin gift cards delivered electronically or printed and packaged for generous giving.  Shipped with a Scarlet Robin thank you card featuring one of our designs.

Pledge $2,500.00 or more - Be a part of the design process and work with our studio to design a custom piece that will be named for you and included in our 2013 Spring/Summer Collection.  Plus, two (2) $100 Scarlet Robin gift cards delivered electronically or printed and packaged for generous giving.  Shipped with a Scarlet Robin thank you card featuring one of our designs.
story_txt:
Our Story
See a Scarlet Robin piece of jewelry, and you'll want to touch it.  Hold it, and you'll want to put it on.  Wear it and, as we hear from hundreds of customers, it will become your daily style signature.
Right now, well over 90% of the 5K+ orders we've crafted have been placed online, by people who couldn't touch or try on before buying.  We come to you for help in getting our silver, gold and copper designs onto the counters of hundreds of boutiques around the world, so that a great many more people can experience the indulgence that is wearing a luxurious, handmade, Scarlet Robin treasure.
How do we take our business from e-commerce to a local shop or boutique near you?  Because it’s impossible for us to visit each and every boutique across the country, we need to be at an event where hundreds of shop owners have gathered.  To do this, we need to be in New York the first week of August for the event where shop owners will come find all the cool merchandise to fill their shelves for the holidays.  It’s like one big shopping spree for boutique owners.
We were chosen to be a part of this event in New York, and we must go!  But its shockingly expensive.  Every bit of your support you share means the world to us.  Every friend you forward our video to and share our story with is incredibly helpful.  You will most definitely be rewarded in all sorts of clever ways—because that’s what we do
 
Your Contribution
Ask any Scarlet Robin customer and they will tell you we have impeccable customer service, hands down.  They will also tell you we provide prompt response to inquiries, incredibly friendly service, and satisfaction in being well taken care of.  You will most certainly not be an exception when it comes time for us to reward you for your financial contribution.
To make your experience a bit more interesting, we thought you would like to see specific items that your contribution will make possible.
If you donate $600, this amount will cover our transportations costs (a plane ticket for Jillian, and gas to/from New York for Jenifer).
Interested in donating $1,500?  Cool!  You just paid for our hotel and lodging expenses for the week.
That $800 burning a hole in your pocket pays for our Fall 2012 Catalog costs.  Sweet!
We will graciously free you from the burden of hiding that $4,000 under your mattress and pay the booth fees for this glorious event. 
Yes, we enjoy having a little fun now and again, but we are incredibly grateful for your donation.  We look forward to the opportunity to personally thank each of you with your very own Scarlet Robin treasure.
For your convenience, we have listed the individual Perks with links to our website below.  We thought you would like to see the special items we picked out for you.
Pledge $5.00 or more - A Scarlet Robin thank you card featuring one of our designs.
Pledge $25.00 or more - You will receive our adorable Bitty Heart necklace on a silicone cord.  Shipped with a Scarlet Robin thank you card featuring one of our designs.
Pledge $50.00 or more - You will receive one of our most popular pieces - a personalized silicone bracelet with a name or word of your choice (up to 8 characters/spaces) hand-stamped on a ½” sterling silver disc accompanied by a birthstone charm.  Shipped with a Scarlet Robin thank you card featuring one of our designs.
Pledge $75.00 or more - Your choice of a 3/8" Silver Micro Monogram on a sterling silver chain or two (2) personalized silicone bracelets with a name or word of your choice (up to 8 characters/spaces) hand-stamped on a ½” sterling silver disc accompanied by a birthstone charm.  Both shipped with a Scarlet Robin thank you card featuring one of our designs.
Pledge $100.00 or more - You may choose from two of our most popular earrings styles; Large Pearl Frames in gold or Stone Frame Earrings.  Shipped with a Scarlet Robin thank you card featuring one of our designs.
Pledge $125.00 or more - One Silver Disc Monogram Necklace with your initial hanging on a sterling silver chain with a birthstone charm.  Shipped with a Scarlet Robin thank you card featuring one of our designs.
Pledge $500.00 or more - Your choice of a Monogram Cutout or Fleur de Lis in gold or silver.  Shipped with a Scarlet Robin thank you card featuring one of our designs.
Pledge $1,250.00 or more - Be a part of the design process and work with our studio to design a custom piece that will be named for you and included in our 2013 Spring/Summer Collection.  Shipped with a Scarlet Robin thank you card featuring one of our designs.
Pledge $2,500.00 or more - Five (5) $100 Scarlet Robin gift cards delivered electronically or printed and packaged for generous giving.  Shipped with a Scarlet Robin thank you card featuring one of our designs.
Pledge $2,500.00 or more - Be a part of the design process and work with our studio to design a custom piece that will be named for you and included in our 2013 Spring/Summer Collection.  Plus, two (2) $100 Scarlet Robin gift cards delivered electronically or printed and packaged for generous giving.  Shipped with a Scarlet Robin thank you card featuring one of our designs.

story:
Over the years we (Nam and Phil) have always wanted to launch a clothing brand. Last year, we finally found a supplier who produces the quality and workmanship we were looking for, with experience with a few labels in Australia and New Zealand. After extensive research, factory trips overseas, and perfecting samples, we discovered the perfect fabrics and worked out our final designs for our opening collection.

We designed every item to fit together as a balanced silhouette. Our pants have a "carrot" fit with a relaxed rise, and our T-shirts, sweaters and coats are slightly elongated to meet mid way on the pant zipper to balance the upper and lower body. A carrot fit means that the upper legs until just past the knees are slightly baggier than the traditional slim jean, going slim from the knee to the ankle. The relaxed rise slightly lowers the crotch of the pants to meet perfectly with the length of our t's and sweaters. 

The fabric is just as important as the fit as we want our pieces to not only be comfortable - we want them to last.

We hope that with this campaign we give you some quality staples, as well as help fund our Spring/Summer ‘19 line.  This includes our website, photography, and sampling costs. 

To start we are offering a package with a crew neck, hoodie and 2 t's - details of each are below.

Hoodie - We chose a brushed 100% cotton for the hoodie. Brushing the cotton during the processing stage, before weaving, removes the short strands of cotton. This process mitigates balling of the material and ensures the sweater will maintain a soft feel. The sweater wears slightly elongated with a hidden front pocket design. Currently offered in black, navy and grey.

Crew Neck - For the crew neck we chose a lighter weight brushed 100% cotton. Similarly, we elongated the sweater to fit slightly longer than a traditional crew neck. Currently offered in black, navy and green.

T- Shirts - We chose a double weaved brushed 100% cotton. A double weaved cotton created a tighter and softer finish to the fabric while maintaining the feel of a traditional cotton. The brushed jersey cotton creates a softer cotton with a slight natural stretch.   

More details on all clothing and the rest of our products will be up on our website, which we hope to have up and running in the next few months. Chinos, jeans and jackets will be available soon.

Many thanks to all who participate. We look forward to sharing our full line soon.

Because the products are being manufactured - need to be shipped to us - then shipped to you, they will be delivered in 5 - 6 weeks.

Phil and Nam

story:
Unlike most tech fleece garments, MINIM doesn't rely on a chemical coating to block moisture. Our fabric contains a state-of-the-art, 10k waterproof membrane, similar to high-end outerwear brands. Because of this, moisture is blocked at the middle of the fabric, leaving the user dry as can be. It's super-soft and flexible properties mimic common fleece, rather than feeling like typically rigid rain gear. 

 
 

 

We're a group of hikers, campers, surfers, and snowboarders. We started MINIM to create versatile pieces that could span our lives, allowing us to focus more on getting outside and less on packing the right gear. We believe that less is more, and in order to fully experience the world, we can't be weighed down with countless material objects. That's why we create all of our garments with 3-in-1 versatility: providing the protection of outerwear, comfort of loungewear, and styling of your favorite daily pieces. Blending innovative materials with utilitarian design, we build our garments for work and play while lasting for years to come.

 

We started with a tailored, unisex fit and added a tapered waist, raglan sleeves, and elevated neck construction. Put shortly, this jacket was form fitted to provide unparalleled motion and flexibility while being active. The fleece is an ultra-soft brushed polyester, designed to provide warmth when you need it and not weigh you down. Each jacket has zip close pockets to keep your stuff safe and reinforced stitching to last for years to come.

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

Our brand was born with the release of our all weather hoodie. After the development and release of this staple piece, we knew that we could create something with even greater versatility. Thus, we brought in our network outdoor lovers and got to work to create something truly special.

 

 

We began with our signature MINIM tech fleece found in our current hoodies and pants. The first step was to replace the outer layer of woven fabric with a brushed fleece. This provided two significant benefits: enhanced flexibility and increased insulation. Woven fabric is typically more rigid than fleece because it is constructed in a tight grid. Replacing this with fleece allowed us to unlock our tech fabric's stretch, enhancing our garments' ability to move with your body. This modification also increased insulation by thickening our heat-retentive layer without compromising our breathability.

The goal of this product line was to blend the functionality of outerwear with the comfort and style of common fleece garments. That's why we paired functional features such as waterproof zippers, enclosing pockets, vents, and cinches with a slimming fit and minimalistic aesthetic.

 

We know the importance of partnering with a like-minded manufacturer when bringing a concept like this to market. That's why, after a two-week journey touring factories across China, we partnered with Yufengling Garment Company. Located near Dongguan, they have a plethora of experience working with high-end western brands while maintaining a safe and clean work environment. They've been making our current product for a year and have already begun producing your Method Jackets!

story:
The Hamtun H1 is the result of over a year of design, iteration and prototyping by Hamtun Ltd, a small Southampton, UK based company. Fully funded in less than 20 minutes and with total funding of more than £140,000, the H1 is now available again for pre-order.

Custom design, high quality parts and genuinely affordable, the H1 is our vision of a modern dive watch.

 

The Hamtun H1 is a custom designed titanium dive watch. Unlike many of the affordable watch campaigns that you'll see, we don't use a generic off-the-shelf case - every part has been designed and built to our exacting standards and specifications. 

 

Our cases are made from high-grade satin finished titanium. Titanium is tough and light, resulting in a solid and substantial timepiece that comes in weighing just 120g.

Our bezel inserts are made from ceramic. Ceramic bezels are far harder to scratch and scuff than metal ones. They have a subtle, classy matte finish, and the markers are filled with lume.

The Hamtun H1 features a double domed sapphire crystal. Sapphire crystals are far more scratch resistant than the mineral ones you often see on affordable watches. It's coated inside and out with an anti-reflective coating for maximum readability in any light. The full height of the watch, including the crystal, is just under 13mm.

The crown, used for winding the watch and setting the date/time, is positioned at the 4 o'clock position. This results in a more comfortable day-to-day wear as in this position it's less likely to push in to your hand. When the watch is wound and the time is set the crown screws down tightly to keep water out.

The date window is at the 4 o'clock position, in line with the crown. The date wheel has been custom made using the same background colour as the watch face, ensuring that the date is subtle and doesn't detract from the design.

The hour markers are cut out of the watch face, allowing the colour underneath to show through. This gives the watch more depth.

The hour markers, bezel markers, hour and minute hands all glow in the dark, making your watch usable even in bad light.

 

We knew the movement had to be automatic. Who wants a quartz diver? Certainly not us. So the challenge was finding a movement that was affordable and reliable. If a watch can't keep good time, it doesn't really matter how great looking or high quality the rest of it is.

We had a few requirements. It had to be automatic, it had to be hand windable, and it had to have hacking seconds.

  • Automatic means that as long as you wear the watch every day or two it should keep itself wound up enough to keep going.
  • Hand winding means that if the watch does stop after a period off the wrist, you can start it again by just winding it up.
  • Hacking seconds means that when you fully pull the crown out the seconds hand stops, making it easier to accurately set the time.

We finally settled on the Seiko NH35A. It allows us to hit our target price for the watch and in our tests it kept better time than any other movement in a similar price bracket. It's also a very popular movement, so if you want to get your watch serviced in the future and don't want to send it back to us, a local watch maker should be able to help you.

 

The H1 was always designed to be a dark, moody looking piece. Initially we worked on just one design, however we finally settled on three designs. You'll be asked which design you would like via a survey when the Kickstarter campaign is complete.

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

Each watch comes with your choice of a titanium bracelet or a silicone strap. Both are custom designed to fit the H1 perfectly. We'll ask you for your preference via a survey when the Kickstarter campaign is complete.

 

 

The Hamtun H1 was designed in the UK but is being manufactured in China. Once the campaign finishes, we'll collect backer preferences and then will place our order with the factories in early November. The timeline we've put together factors in Chinese holidays in the new year. We'll work hard to beat this schedule, but currently we expect to deliver in May 2017.

Throughout the manufacturing and quality control phases we will keep all backers updated on our Facebook page, via Twitter, and via email.

 

Every Hamtun H1 comes with a 2 year warranty against manufacturing or movement defects.

 

The Hamtun H1 will ship worldwide. When backing the project, you'll be asked where in the world you'd like your watch shipped to and the appropriate fee will be added to your pledge. We'll contact you when the project funds to get your address.

The Hamtun H1 ships from the UK via courier to anywhere worldwide. If you're outside the EU, you'll need to confirm any import duties you may be required to pay with your local customs office.

This campaign quickly flew past the funding goal and left us with some decisions to make. We're delivering what we hope is a great value watch, but by doing so we do not have huge margins with which to offer vast number of "free" extras. The majority of the extra funding will go in to ensuring that quality is of a very high standard, by both having extra checks at the factory and here before dispatch to you.

However there were a few requests that kept coming up in discussion, so we've managed to secure the following stretch goals. We hope that a big focus on quality and these extras make everyone happy.

If we reach £50,000 we’ll upgrade the lume across all watched to Super-LumiNova. On the dial and bezel this will be blue BGW9.

THIS GOAL HAS BEEN UNLOCKED

If we reach the £75,000 mark we’ll include both the custom silicone strap and custom titanium bracelet with all watchers. Ordered more than one watch? Each of them will get both straps.

THIS GOAL HAS BEEN UNLOCKED

If we reach £85,000 we’ll drill the lugs through. This makes swapping straps far easier, and also allows use of stronger bars to attach you straps, meaning it'll be even more secure on your dives.

THIS GOAL HAS BEEN UNLOCKED

If we reach £100,000 we’ll put serial numbers on the back of all of the watches. This will identify your watch as part of the first production run. Those on the super early-bird reward level will get a low number.

THIS GOAL HAS BEEN UNLOCKED

story:
Small town girl with a big dream...

Bodomah Bohemia is a brand built on being a dreamer! Feeling totally free to be yourself... After all, there is no finer person to be... right!?

Our collections are designed for the free-thinkers, the wanderers, the soul bearers, the original, and most importantly the dreamers of the world.

Based in the UK, Bodomah Bohemia longs for adventure, living on the edge and enjoying the little things. This usually involves salt in our hair, smiles on our faces and memories in our hearts.

I created the brand with a vision of long beaches, floaty kimono's and blossoming friendships. I guess this is the part where I introduce myself... My name is Loretta and I live in a small town in Yorkshire in the UK. I set up Bodomah Bohemia off the back of my fashion degree with the passion to create and to inspire. I hand-make all my designs from my small home studio. I run this ship solo, which can be tough at times, but I have already had a great response and a lot of support from my new friends around the world, which really makes this adventure worth holding onto.  I am a small town girl with a big dream, one that you may be able to help turn into a reality. I have an opportunity to showcase my collection to a well known fashion retailer in the new year (Amazing right!?) and I have so many fresh ideas for designs that I wish to create, including an accessories line.

An opportunity like this is so very rare to a fashion designer and as you can imagine I need to run with it. The ultimate dream is to be stocked in boutiques worldwide, and this opportunity could really be my big break. In order to do this they need to see samples of my collection, as well as an idea of the direction my brand is heading. This will include designs of future collections and samples too. 

The £2,500 I need will all be spent on fabrics to create the collection. I make every single item by hand so there is no need for a production line cost.

I have a range of special perks available to you... Including bespoke kimono's made just for you, vouchers, framed bohemian typography, and even the chance to name your own design that will be in the final collection (and receive that item git wrapped too). 

Any little helps at this stage and even if I don't reach my target, I assure you it will help immensely to create the clothing collection of my dreams (and hopefully yours too). 

My journey is hopefully just beginning... So jump on board and hold on tight!


Please... Please... Please... SHARE this page to your friends! Get the word out of this upcoming beach wear brand. Thank you for helping make my dreams come true. Love & Peace, Bodomah Bohemia xoxo

The £2,500 I need will all be spent on fabrics to create the collection. I make every single item by hand so there is no need for a production line cost.
I have a range of special perks available to you... Including bespoke kimono's made just for you, vouchers, framed bohemian typography, and even the chance to name your own design that will be in the final collection (and receive that item git wrapped too). 
Any little helps at this stage and even if I don't reach my target, I assure you it will help immensely to create the clothing collection of my dreams (and hopefully yours too). 
My journey is hopefully just beginning... So jump on board and hold on tight!

    
    Please... Please... Please... SHARE this page to your friends! Get the word out of this upcoming beach wear brand. Thank you for helping make my dreams come true. Love & Peace, Bodomah Bohemia xoxo

story:
Design Miners are on air! 

You can listen ‘Classic Design’ by Dariusz Stańczuk in RMF Classic when I talk about saving the history of Polish design exhibitions here.   


...and on line!                               

"Perks are brilliant and the doctoral thesis vital for Polish design history" -

"The heritage of our visual culture is worth saving" - 

          


                      

    



Design Miners at the London Design Festival

Bashko Trybek's Made of Coal pieces was shown at the Young Creative Poland - 4 Years On exhibition during London Design Festival alongside the video teaser. Thank you all for popping in and the positive freedback!



What is the Design Miners all about?

The Design Miners gets together people and organisations that want to get involved in digging into history of design and exhibitions in particular.

What coal has to do with design?

The whole story begins with coal that used to be called Poland’s "black gold”. From the late 40s, in order to promote it on the international market, the state commissioned the best creative professionals to design trade fair displays that would impress audiences around the globe. These exhibitions – prepared by visionary graphic designers, architects, painters and musicians – are part of the bigger narrative that I am trying to explore.

 

Image courtesy of Stanisław Zamecznik Archive, Museum of Modern Art, Warsaw, www.artmuseum.pl/en

=

Image courtesy of Museum of the Academy of Fine Arts, Warsaw.

Cash for coal

To thank you, I curated a special collection of black gold pieces designed by rising stars of Polish design.  


Thank you so much for your support!

A unique hand-picked coal briquet that inspired Kazimir Malevich and Konstantin Gricic. Photo: Salvatore Gozzo. Courtesy of Konstantin Grcic Industrial Design (KGID).


An exclusive edition of Design Miners cotton tote bag.

 A specially prepared book featuring interviews with exhibition designers, an essay and selection of archival photographs from Polish design exhibitions that has never been published before. Your name will be credited in the book. Estimated delivery: January 2014.


An organic lump of activated Carbon Soap. Designed by Mamami Studio.


A pair of unique hand-crafted coal and 925 silver earings. Regular or irregular shapes, ⌀ 13 mm. Limited edition of 10. Designed by Pracownia broKat.


Original hand-crafted coal and 925 silver ring. Available in 2 shapes and 4 sizes (US): 8–15 mm, 13–17 mm, 15–17,5 mm, 16/17–18 mm. Designed and made in Poland. Limited edition of 10. Designed by Pracownia broKat.

Original hand-crafted coal and 925 silver ring. Available in 2 shapes and 4 sizes (US): 8–15 mm, 13–17 mm, 15–17,5 mm, 16/17–18 mm. Designed and made in Poland. Limited edition of 10. Designed by Pracownia broKat.


An exclusive pair of hand-made coal and 935 silver cufflinks. Limited edition of 10. Designed by Pracownia broKat.


I invite you to explore the coal legacy in Poland. The tour includes architect guided tour of the award-winning Bolko mine converted into modern loft and a tour through mysterious underground passages of the historic "Guido" Coal Mine in Zabrze. (Includes dinner + accommodation for one night. Travel not included). Photo of Bolko Loft: Juliusz Sokołowski.



Contemporary design piece from “Made of Coal” collection by Bashko Trybek – one-off bowl commissioned by Depot Basel, presented during Milan Design Week 2013 and London Design Festival 2013 and featured in various design publications.  


How the Design Miners was initiated?

I started digging into the history of design exhibitions in 2011, when I was accepted on a doctoral program in History of Design at the Royal College of Art, London. The research gained recognition from the international Design History Society and the Polish Ministry of Heritage and Culture, which resulted in short term research grants. It was also included in the program of a conference organised at the Parsons’ New School of Design in New York, at the Royal College of Art in London and recently at the Modernist Studies Association annual conference held at the University of Sussex in at Brighton. 

I initiated Design Miners to raise funds to complete this research on time and save an important part of cultural, economical and political history of Eastern Europe from being forgotten. I need your help to make it happen. 


What your money will go for?

The money you will contribute will go towards researching the exhibitions' history. To complete it, I need to raise £38,700. That covers remaining tuition fees of £16,256 and the minimal costs of two years research – such as obtaining archival materials, travels, accommodation and other expenses. 

I set up the campaign goal as a moderate £10,000. This amount would enable me to cover part of the research expenses and continue the work. 

Design Miners is a flexible campaign, which means that if we reach the goal, the fees from indiegogo.com will be 4% instead of 9% of the raised amount.


Can I join?

Yes! Just click on the "Contribute now" button on the right and choose the amount you want to support the project with. 

You can also spread the word about the Design Miners among your friends and family. Share info about the project on your Facebook, Twitter and other platforms. 

Thank you!


Who's that girl?

Apart from doing this research, I also curate exhibitions, publish texts on design and teach graphic design students at Central Saint Martins, London. You can read more about the things I do in my online portfolio www.kasiajezowska.com.

story:
The Project:

Underhill is one of the first green-roof homes in New Jersey:  it will conserve energy, reduce stormwater runoff, and preserve habitat for plants and animals. Designed to support a full 12" of earth on its roof, it goes beyond simple green roofing to allow a full restoration of landscape over the top of it: shrubs, small trees, and other plants native to its woodland location.  Sitting deep in a hillside, it has relatively low exposed walls - and those are built of native stone that we gathered on-site. For more information visit BuildUnderhill.com.

Phase 1 of the project was built with our own hands, our own muscles and sweat, the help of friends, and $175,000 of our own money.  We're past the halfway point in construction.  Now begins Phase 2:  well, septic, roof completion, doors and windows, waterproofing, and habitat restoration.  Many of these elements are things we can't do ourselves (we don't know how to drill a 250' deep well!).  We need $80,000 for this phase, and that's the challenge:  because we're self-employed people building an innovative home, we can't get a bank loan to complete the project.  That's why we're turning to you.

The Impact

By joining the project, you become part of a bigger picture.  You're not only building a home that conserves energy, minimizes stormwater runoff, reduces the urban heat island effect, and maximizes habitat for plants & animals.  You're also making it a little easier for the next green builder.  Because next time, a bank can say, "Yes, we know this type of architecture.  There's a house like that nearby - yes, we'll finance your green-roof home."

A little more about us:

 I’m Jim Reilly, the owner and architect of Underhill.  I drew the plans, and I work as general contractor on the project, in addition to doing most of the day-to-day construction.  By profession, I’m an actor.  In 2010 I married Nancy Candea. 

Nancy is a yoga therapist and personal trainer.  She trains yoga teachers to work in prisons, shelters, senior centers, and veterans' hospitals, through the nonprofit she founded, Yoga Impact.  Nancy is the brains behind this indiegogo campaign, and she’s designed perks for you that will support your health and wellness.  The friends that have helped us so far are actors, a director, two accountants, an auto mechanic, a physical therapist, a sales rep, and a CEO.

Underhill is the biggest dream of my life, the dream to which all other plans and goals come second.  I have no greater dream than to build Underhill and serve the world by so doing.

Visit BuildUnderhill.com for architectural plans, photos, and an itemized cost breakdown of Phase 2.  I’ve also included some “war stories” about the surprises and challenges during construction.  Underhill will be our home, but this isn’t just our dream.  This is a house that will make the world better.

What We Need 

We need $80,000 to complete Phase 2 and enclose the house. (We have some great perks for you - see sidebar).  These funds will complete the structural roof, drill the well, install the septic system, place the soil and vegetation on the roof, finish the exterior grading, and put in the doors and windows.  Some of this work must be done by contractors (well, septic, earthmoving).  For much of it, though, your support goes only to materials, and the labor will ours: Jim’s, Nancy’s, and our friends & neighbors.  When Phase 2 completes, the house will be ready for interior finishing.  Visit BuildUnderhill.com’s “Cost Breakdown” page for the itemized budget.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you have building materials to donate, contact us at BuildUnderhill@gmail.com It may be just the thing we need!

And please let your friends know about our campaign - we have just 45 days to complete our campaign, so that we can launch Phase 2 construction on January 1, 2014.

story:
Vagrant Soles Apparel

The Basiczzz

Hello, indies!  The name's Matt Meneely.  I'm a 23 year old bachelor stuck at a major crossroads in my life.  "Do what makes you happy, and you'll never work a day in your life."  This was the quote I constantly heard from my overstressed and overworked father.  Now that I am faced with 2 different roads, "safe career" and my passion, he's suddenly forgotten his simple quote.

My goal is to prove his quote right.  While I have a decent job for my age, which does stress me out, I don't wake up in the morning with any sort of ambition or drive.  Monotony has become my middle name. 

Ever since I was a kid, most of my time was spent on a skateboard or my bike.  I built trails behind my elementary school to pass the time.  My love for BMX ignited when the neighboring city of Evansville built a skatepark called "Lamasco."  Initially banning bikes, after the city quit caring about the "degenerates" and "delinquints" who frequently inhabited it, bikes started creeping in.  That's when the real passion took aflame. 

Fairly recent edit of me and some buddies. Older ones on the same dudes vimeo profile.   http://vimeo.com/24809718

I was attracted to the comradery and constant progression that I found within the skatepark environment. The heavy hitters who I looked up to seemed to live a fast lifestyle,  which was always appealing to me.  With the retirement age growing by the year, why not live for now?  This is what I plan to embody with my company.

Anyways, I went to college and studied psychology for three years, but was burned out with all the papers and partying (Death to MLA and APA Formats!!!).  I was luckily accepted as a union electrician which has sustained me for the past 2 years. 

 

Get to the Point!! 

My campaign, Vagrant Soles (VGNT), is a way for me to put my "two cents" into the fashion world, and therefore social world, about the issues I find within it.  I am an overly cynical and paranoid young man who sees a lot of wrong in today's existence.  Why?  I'm not sure, as I had a magical and bright upbringing.  I plan to show the world the darker side that is commonly overlooked, in hopes of connecting to those who agree with my idea of what is really important in life and to create products that are deeper than fabric and print.

 

But the campaign's called Vagrant "Soles." What about the shoes?! 

Good question!  The original idea was to produce a simple and light bmx/skate/casual shoe that likeminded "shredders" want to wear.
So I did what I could and got a prototype made.  I've been shredding on them for 2 months.  The reason I'm not trying to sell them yet is that there are some changes that need to be made, and I want to offer the best product to the consumer, which will take some time.  But they do shred damn well!

 

You keep using the term "shred." Please elaborate.

Well when someone asks me to define "shred," I refer to the Spongebob episode where Spongebob tries to explain "FUN" to fuddyduddy Plankton.  It's rather difficult but here's my attempt at it.  Shredding basically means doing what you're passionate about and doing it well, be it bmx, skateboarding, painting, piano, guitar, or whatever and consistently doing what you can to progress!  Obviously my shoes will be designed with the BMX/skateboarder in mind, which also means they will hold up for less "foot-intensive" activities.  My hope is that the Vagrant Soles message will appeal to those who have a burning love for their hobby and a desire to keep getting better.

 

That's all fine and dandy, but why should I buy your merch?

Why should you buy my merch? Hmmm. 

I am a man of my word, and while I can't boast my creddentials over the internet, I can hope to establish a trust with interested consumers.

The "trust" being the fact that I will do what I can to deliver durable, functional, and sweet looking products to my fellow shredders.  For now, the prices are higher than I had hoped, but will be cheaper once bulk orders are necessary and I have master the "Logistics Monster." 

Nowadays, lack of trust is a major issue of today's world that I hope to combat.  Too damn cut-throat!

Supporting Vagrant Soles will also support the up-and-comers of the shred community.  I plan generate extensive exposure for those who rock my products.  This will help others to try and live the same type of life I want to live.  I support the underdogs.

I want to create a successful company which will give me time to work on my shredder hobbies.  Aside from bmx, my main creative hobbies are photography and music production.  I am depressed when I am trapped in a noncreative lifestlye, and I'm sure most would feel the same. 

Supporting this campaign would be mega sweet. 

 

What are your future goals for Vagrant Soles?

I have many, I am a dreamer through and through.

My first goal would be to establish myself as a credible merchant of awesome products.  This is a huge part of what this company will be about.  While the products are simple, this will be a "watch us grow" company.  I'm calling the first releases the "1st Gen" products.  With more funds and exposure, I can design more radical and complex designs to keep the shred moving!

My second goal with this company is to try my hand in the high competition shoe market.  I sincerely believe if people knew the ideaology behind the company, they will give the kicks a try and love them.  While the shirt/whatever designs will become better with complexity, I want to keep the shoes simple.  Many shoes I see are way too flashy/flamboyent for my taste, and hopefully others (hopefully a niche market).
Again, this goal will take some time.

The third goal would be to create a fully automated and problem-free customer experience so as to give me more time to explore my creative vibes, thus improving future products.  I want to go completely mobile, with a murdered-out Hurse, some Vagrant Soles products, my camera, and like two pairs of clothes and meet others who share my passion.  I feel cluttered with my possessions, and want to break free of them!

My fourth goal would be to get into the the female market.  I love the ladies, and they look super sexy in the right clothes.  My hopes are to make women at least 40% of my market (kind of a stretch given my company image).  I hope I can find a cute little thing that likes me well enough to model my stuff, and maybe grab a bite. ;)

My fifth goal is to bring followers a behind the scenes look at my life and the company.  I have a huge hard-on for documentaries, and have many dreams of making some sweet unadulterated documentaries showcasing some radical individuals.

My sixth goal, and ultimate goal (hints the company name), is to donate time and products to those in need.  I was scheming up a way to go to an orphanage and donate my kicks.  Sounds like a PR move, while it would be beneficial to the company, it would be deeper than what it appears.  Childrens' Homes, I believe they are called now, foster children who grow up with the idea that they are less valuable than other members of society.  Growing up with this mentality will undoubtedly create a self-fulfilling prophecy for them (hopefully this doesn't happen and more civil service is being done to avoid this).  My dream is to have a "shred event" for these children, giving them my shoes, my time and entertainment.  The entertainment being some buddies of mine who happen to work for a major BMX distributor who also happen to have ramps for such occasions to "jump" around and get them excited about the sport.  I feel that just by showing people care about what happens to these children, could ultimately change their path in life for the better.  The more successful this company becomes, the more "underdogs" I can help.  Imagine how rewarding it would be to know you've changed multiple lives of kids for the better!   Extremely rewarding.

 

 

Ok, now what about the perkzz?

 

Perk 1: $1-7 Help the Cause

You and I obviously think alike, which is a huge booster for this company.  I will hope to one day run into you and buy you a soda!  I will be thinking of you!

 

Perk 2: $8- The Vagrant Soles Koozie

Simple and lightweight koozie to keep your shredhands warm, and you're "soda" cold! Drink with a purpose.  Shipping included.

 

Perk 3: $16- VGNT Blinders

One pair of simple and lightweight shred shades to ward off the non-shredders!
Shipping included.

 

Perk 4:  $30- The First Vagrant Tee!

Sweet VGNT shirt to look sexy while you shred and to support the shred movement!
Will ask for sizes after the 30 days has reached an end.

 

Perk 5:  $52- Shred Blood Cell Count Bundlezz

You will receive the aforementioned products to ensure that the shred will continue.  The complete first gen set that will start the shredder empire!  Will ask for sizes after the 30 days has reached an end.

 

Perk 6: $1000- He Did What?!


You will receive the aforementioned products to ensure that the shred will continue. IN ADDITION I will personally visit you to solve the problems of the world, talk about the company, attempt to teach you how to barspin, as well as vacuum 1 room in your home of your choosing.  Vacuum must be provided and please dont live in Alaska or Hawaii.

 

Expected delivery seems far off, but I hope to get the products to you sooner.  I'm just using the date as a cushion.

New to this website but I hope to find some of your sweet campaigns to help fund!

 

NOTE: If you for some reason aren't completely on the same page as Vagrant Soles, but are curious about it, generate some talk! VGNT will take all the word of mouth we can get!  The weirder the better!  SPREAD THE SHRED!  Oh and use the indiegogo share tools!  I'll give you an imaginary french kiss!

 

Final Words of Wisdom

I want to become a man of the people.  Any advice/questions/concerns/ideas are openly accepted and appreciated.  If you are reading this, you have either read this entire post, or skimmed it.  Either way, you have my sincere thanks.

Expect a video and some more images very shortly!

With much shredlove,

Matthew Meneely

P.S.  Feel free to add me on Facebook.  I won't make it too weird.
